title: 🕹️Frontier 与育碧合作能否为GameFi行业带来新生机？
body:
先写在前，由于这篇文章是上个月先在公会中与团队分享的，所以部分数据可能有滞后性，请大家根据自己判断做出选择。

调研员twitter：[@egoorcs](https://twitter.com/eg00rcs)

游戏官网：<https://www.missingfrontier.com/home>

游戏twitter：<https://twitter.com/missingfrontier>

1\.游戏简介

[Frontier](https://www.missingfrontier.com/)是一款快节奏且具有竞技性的免费在线 P2E 游戏，融合了实时战术和 MOBA 元素。它目前正在开发中并由育碧支持。通过摧毁他们的基地来歼灭你的敌人，同时保护你自己的。利用 Flash Blocks 进行强大的攻击或为对手设置陷阱，或为自己的单位加电以使其在战场上持续更长时间。使用 Glitch Blocks 作为终极技能来消灭敌人，从而统治战场。

2\.路线图

详细路线图可以参考[官网](https://www.missingfrontier.com/roadmap)，这里我将简单概括一下。

目前游戏在第一阶段，这个阶段主要的任务是发布白皮书及ICO，并且将游戏迁移到L2。

第一阶段结束后将发布游戏，时间大约为22年的7\~10月份，之后就会进入游戏的第二阶段。

第二阶段将会开放手工制作，可以让玩家自由组合Flash Blocks，同时会开放F2P引导非加密玩家入场。

3\.数据

3\.1 社交网站

3\.1.1 Twitter

Twitter共有48k关注人数。推文发送频率较高，平时会有一些转发推文的小活动。

3\.1.2 Discord

Discord共有14k社区成员，如果在社区提问MOD回复比较迅速，虽然游戏开发时间较长，但是社区很少有FUD，氛围良好。

3\.2 NFT

3\.2.1 人物

人物目前分为两种 [Zero](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/6) 和 [Zero S](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/5)，Zero创世纪10000个、Zero S创世纪3300个。~~持有这两个NFT可以获得PFP空投通行证，Zero S有机会获得更稀有的通行证。~~现在需要燃烧NFT才可以获得通行证[Watch ID](https://opensea.io/collection/watchid)。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/p9UIPDmxW0tY3OYc6zzoO.png?height=267&width=482)

在[Opense](https://opensea.io/collection/frontiergame)上面购买不同的皮肤可以在游戏开始后获得不同量的$DATA代币。

皮肤可以和Data Key一起燃烧创造Stellar Key，这两个物品我将在后文分析，每个皮肤只可以燃烧一次，皮肤燃烧后将保存在游戏的皮肤收藏里并等待游戏开始后空投$DATA代币。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TpRIEoZiWaDbeFDV5csnn.png?height=195&width=573)

3\.2.2 游戏NFT道具

3\.2.2.1 Flash Blocks

Flash Blocks是可以在战场上使用的武器和盾牌、陷阱和黑客。标准的Flash Blocks分为4个等级，Classic、Epic、Stellar和Acme，另外还有一些独特的闪光块可以通过合成等途径获得。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2RU2Pf50gyf_arcWzvn6P.png?height=678&width=3537)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iKOpkjdIHX4flG-q4hR2A.png?height=870&width=1392)

Flash Blocks可以合成提升等级：3个Classic可以合成一个Epic、2个Epic可以合成一个Stellar、2个不相关的Flash Blocks可以合成1个独特的Flash Blocks。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/y-8HKhEaq1STKxVhhz6pG.png?height=767&width=1394)

3\.2.2.2 Flash Blocks Droids和Glitch Blocks

[Flash Blocks机器人](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/9)和[Glitch Blocks](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/4)也可以在游戏中使用：

Flash Blocks机器人（图左）是持有[Black Box](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/1)的空投礼品，后期可以燃烧提升其他Flash Blocks的等级。

Glitch Blocks（图右）是战场上的终极武器，和Flash Blocks类似，不过使用的冷却时间较长。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/WEoAqApHEoX3rg2l_KlqG.png?height=1111&width=1394)

3\.2.3 非游戏NFT道具

3\.2.3.1 [Black Box](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/1)

黑盒子一共有3000个，每个盒子包含1个[Data Keys](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/36)和2个随机Flash Blocks。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jCCvNffRge37sibEmfuKg.png?height=545&width=685)

3\.2.3.2 **[Data Center](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/37)**

持有数据中心可以为玩家持续提供免费的$DATA代币。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/nxSkHEzaglEQ6kvzLoo2r.png?height=376&width=453)

3\.2.3.3 钥匙

持有[Data Keys](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/36)可以获得投票权、治理权和一些代币白名单特权。[The Stellar Key](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/38)是[Data Keys](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/36)的升级版，除了有[Data Keys](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/36)的特权外还会有版税等额外的奖励。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TUNIXGxVINr7iBxgxNEiW.png?height=548&width=686)

3\.2.3.4 [Flash Drives](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/7)

持有[Flash Drives](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/7)允许持有者借出Flash Blocks给别的玩家并获利。普通[Flash Drives](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/7)可以收取70%的利润，剩下30%利润归国库所有。[Stellar Flash Drive](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/8)可以收取90%利润。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dKvtIELXCrl8OMhhIrqOd.png?height=548&width=684)

3\.2.3.5 Merch Token

Merch分为三个等级[Classic](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/58)、[Epic](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/59)、[Stellar](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/60)。Classic、Epic将会被兑换成Frontier实物商品，Stellar可以被兑换成恒星钥匙，具体细节目前还没有。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VJxWv1_mSRsrDU6ZR2oHP.png?height=547&width=684)

3\.2.3.6 [Watch ID](https://opensea.io/collection/watchid)

每个[Watch ID](https://opensea.io/collection/watchid) PFP的持有者都会获得游戏终身赛季通行证，会提供额外的奖励，目前可以通过燃烧人物Zero和Zero S获得。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/4S8vpjqrqOxtfVEqXG2eQ.png?height=1092&width=1388)

4\.游戏解析

目前游戏玩法暂无还在早期，我将在总结界面分析一下进场策略。

5\.团队及投资方

虽然在互联网上搜不到育碧对Frontier有投资，不过通过项目方的twitter发现Frontier和育碧是有一定关联的，个人认为这是育碧借Frontier工作室对WEB3游戏的一次试水。因为育碧一直是比较看好NFT的，在去年也曾推出自己的项目[Quartz](https://www.gamespot.com/articles/ubisoft-first-nfts-are-like-steam-marketplace-on-the-blockchain/1100-6498699/)。

关于团队及资方的其他信息暂时搜集不到，这目前是一个小小的隐患点，不过既然有顶级游戏公司做背书，个人认为问题不大。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2aeBUDN1paNa45P4QqNhC.png?height=1809&width=818)

6\.总结

首先我先来分析一下NFT的持仓，根据nansen图表，自2021年底Frontier的NFT发布以来，普通持仓地址较为稳定，Smart Money一路增持，大部分投资者对于游戏有较高的预期。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/WQMKqz1aGttqpPoSC1is3.png?height=1419&width=1935)

接下来我们挑两个钻石手的地址来分析burli.eth和rawa.eth，两个都是NFT鲸鱼玩家，同时我也大致看了一下其他的钻石手地址，盈利地址占比较大。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/q2wjv0L_uKtPf69XH_kOb.png?height=726&width=1937)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3AwwvQ7scG99J69by0ZnC.png?height=901&width=2661)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/in3LSXv2B00C1D1l-n3Yv.png?height=908&width=2691)

最后我讲一下我自己的入场策略：建议主要配置地板的人物和游戏物品（表格中绿色背景的NFT），至少配备一个Data Key & The Stellar Key以博取后期有可能新NFT的白名单，至少配备一个Flash Drive & Stellar Flash Drive用来以后出租NFT使用。

如果投资金额大建议配备The Stellar Key可以获取版税分红，配备Stellar Flash Drive获取90%出租的NFT分成，也可以配备一个**[Data Center \[Epic\]](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x236672ed575e1e479b8e101aeeb920f32361f6f9/37)**以获得持续的$DATA代币收入。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uFC17TCUZJ6f3iFpg8uBY.png?height=1037&width=998)

title: what's up, the name's amri.
body:
ok not really, but that’s what i’m going as.

if this is the first time coming across my profile, i’m an artist/engineer/streetwear designer + this is my first attempt at combining everything i’ve worked on in my life into a single stream of consciousness. 

i’m currently in the middle of launching my second NFT project as an artist, but i’ve done a bunch more art throughout my life and have been creating for my streetwear brand since 2018.

my whole life i’ve been trying to figure out the best channel to go down in order to share my art with the world. i discovered nfts in january 2021, and have been working as an engineer in the space while doing side projects for my creative expression. there’s been a lot of noise i’ve had to navigate and i’ve been figuring things out along the way. i worked on my first nft project last year for 5 months and built the whole thing myself, which was one of the most rewarding experiences in my career. even though only \~3% of the nfts got minted, the process taught me a lot about what i was able to create if i put myself into my work. 

since then i’ve switched jobs and have started working on a new project in my spare time, bc i don’t want to stop creating. i’ve let go of a lot of the fluff i had in mind the first time around, and am taking this shit less seriously now. motorheadz will be free art for those visually interested in my work and mark the beginning of a new personal journey for me. i want to begin to allow myself to freely create art without trying to tailor anything to anyone. this is what makes me happiest, and is the only way that i can look back at my work and be proud of what i’m doing. 

after i finish this motorheadz mint i’m embarking on a journey to build out the world that has always existed in my head. i’m forever grateful to everyone who’s supported me on my journey til now-- y’all are who i create for and the support is what keeps me motivated.

title: Soulda：探寻与你「灵魂同频」的 Web3 居民
body:
以比特币和以太坊为代表的 Crypto 市场沉闷的近况，让 Web3 建设者们时隔两年又一次切身体会到了熊市的冰冷感，不过在硬币的另一面，本轮牛市中加密世界最火热的新概念NFT看似又找到了新的叙事点。社区自治的黑猫 MIMIC 在市场上迅速蹿红引发了NFT新玩法的激烈讨论，而自项目推出以来运营节奏与 MIMIC 颇为相似，无论从设计还是玩法上都融合了今年正当红的MBTI 人格测试的 PFP NFT 项目 Soulda，会成为下一只起跳的黑猫吗？

## 进入Soulda，找寻最真实的自己

### 基础信息

Soulda NFT总量 7777 个，其中保留 1111 个作为早期合作活动空投，未来社区活动抽奖，与项目团队。项目于7月5日正式上架 OpenSea，截止撰文时 Holder 数量约 2300 人，总成交额 113 ETH。考虑到公开mint时每个地址可以 Mint 两枚 NFT，因此上线至今项目的筹码相对稳定。

![Soulda 在OpenSea 的页面](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9P6RLBnqEmjtZMU7NYmGT.png?height=1374&width=2250)

### 特色玩法：你的 PFP 更能代表你自己

据团队透露，Soulda NFT 旨在结合心理学和 NFT 来体现独特的「你」。项目方会根据每个人独特的性格结果，发放最契合个人性格的 NFT 作品。

在 Soulda 官网中的[ Fountain](https://soulda16.club/fountain) 页面，玩家可以进行一个简版的 MBTI 性格测试。Mint 前完成测试的用户可以收到特定 SOUL TAG（灵魂标签）对应的专属 Soulda NFT，如若 Mint 前未进行测试，则铸造的NFT会随机发放。不过用户在 Mint 结束后仍然可以去进行性格测试，并根据结果找到与个人性格匹配的 Soulda NFT 作品购买。据官方介绍，未来每张 Soulda NFT 结合不同 SOUL TAG 会解锁更多超能力等级玩法。而每个地址只能拥有一个 SOUL TAG。

![我个人的 SOUL TAG](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8VArq1mfQveH49tYARUJ-.png?height=1350&width=2814)

而也正是与 MBTI 16 型人格相对应的巧思，成为了 Soulda NFT 与当下主流 PFP 作品形成差异化竞争的关键，那么Soulda NFT是如何体现人格特色呢？在视觉设计上，艺术家采用了四类性格特征作为区分，并进行了相当多细节上的打磨：

**内向 I (Introverted)**: 使用剪影的表现手法，呈现出安静平和的内心世界。你会看到有星空，有晚霞...内心的你，眼睛里面有一只发光的小狗。

**外向 E (Extroverted)**: 形象的五官和头发呈现出向外延申的视觉感触，夸张的表情，或者带Tattoo 的元素。

**感知 S (Sensing)**: 由触碰实物带来的强感知能力，形象喜欢用手、嘴巴接触新鲜事物，比如叼着鲜花或者扑克牌。

**直觉 N (iNtuition)**: 由天生直觉所带来的感触抽象概念的能力，画面使用星空、光碟、鸽子等物件环绕，形象不实际接触物体。

![四种核心性格 IP 图解](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lq5q0JeG8lsGVC1n5EN4i.jpeg?height=1775&width=2048)

### 为什么MBTI这么火？

回到 MBTI本身，MBTI（Myers–Briggs Type Indicator）是一种自我报告式的人格类型测试工具。

MBTI测试重点关注四个大类，并对每个大类做出了两个子类的区分，分别是：

内向（Introversion）或外向（Extroversion）

实感（Sensing）或直觉（Intuition）

思考（Thinking）或情感（Feeling）

判断（Judging）或感知（Perceiving）

取各类别的首字母，就可以得出测试的结果，如“INFP”、“ESFJ”......四个维度的不同偏好排列组合，便形成 16 种人格类型。

![MBTI 16 型人格](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-zmP_TQQCLFZdGHSlkxSz.jpeg?height=1280&width=640)

MBTI 之所以能够如此之火，很大程度上是因为其足够通俗易懂，不同于主流心理学那套「优势功能」、「劣势功能」、「主导功能」还有「从属功能」的生僻定义，MBTI 所描绘的人格画像几乎毫无门槛，也更易传播。

而 MBTI 本身也为社区参与者提供了更强的归属感，可以更方便地寻找到「同好」，并基于此培养出更强的社区凝聚力，这一点对于意在实现更 Web3 的社区自治的 Soulda 来说，实则颇有裨益。

### 创始团队

RIVA，Soulda 的联合创始人。他曾在 IDEO 和 Frog Design 担任设计总监——世界上最好的设计咨询公司之一。他曾创造过 30 多种产品，拥有 50 多项专利，并获得了 65 多项国际奖项。

127，前育碧艺术家，创作并出版了《Art of Change》。他是 CDQ 杂志 20 画廊艺术家和 2020 年 Procreate 艺术奖的获得者。

JANO，曾就职于摩根大通、阿里巴巴和 Frog Design。

LEWIS，自身代码研究者、Web3 开发人员，曾任职亚马逊/IBM/Strategy Consulting。

十一，一个复杂而多面的灵魂，与 Michael Jordan, Ernest Hemingway, Amelia Earhart, Frida Kahlo, Arya Stark, Indiana Jones 等人共同航行在蔚蓝灵魂的海洋里。

![Soulda 核心成员](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/4wMgBI7nErEBpFPYTLsJC.jpeg?height=1089&width=2048)

在团队成立初期，也不乏有精彩的小故事，据 RIVA 和127回忆，RIVA最早在全球寻觅过很多艺术家作品，却总觉得缺乏一种灵魂感，最后他看到了[127的个人社交账号](https://www.instagram.com/alonelee127/)，随即就给对方发了邮件。而据127回忆，区别于其他项目的邀请，RIVA在开篇第一句话中就提了四次「灵魂」这个字眼，这一度让127觉着他是个骗子，不过在一些机缘巧合促成的进一步交流过后，这几个极具理想化的「灵魂」走到了一起。

### 项目营销

Soulda 以“Art NFT”的身份入选 [#NFTNYC2022](https://twitter.com/hashtag/NFTNYC2022?src=hashtag_click) ，并[在纽约时代广场上进行投屏展示](https://www.nft.nyc/Art)。据了解，这个名额在 2000 个项目作品中仅选中 200 个，可见其艺术上的认可度。

![NFTNYC2022](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kPOYaw2H6t5GcACb0_9Q2.png?height=958&width=966)

Soulda 专门做了 6 位名人大 V 的定制款头像。其中有提出 Web3 去中心化「灵魂绑定」概念的以太坊创始人 Vitalik Buterin，全球音乐人兼 NFT收藏家、NFT项目创始人 Snoop Dogg和 Steve Aoki，创作圈鬼才歌手 Billie Eilish 和 Sia，都是精心挑选的「灵魂」代表性人物。

![Soulda 定制款头像](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/CAmne5eOrqUjCf5TjTYBq.jpeg?height=7269&width=2160)

### 未来计划

据团队介绍，Soulda 下阶段会进行一次空投——Soulda Bomb，预计一到两个月内实现。市场方面制定了关于人物故事板块，「灵魂」选美大赛，二创大赛以及相应的抽 Souda NFT活动。

未来，Soulda NFT 计划推出质押功能，利用 SOUL TAG 与 Soulda NFT 的搭配，形成翻倍效应。

### 机遇和挑战

Soulda 的项目运营未来将交由社区自治，最新公告可以看出，团队创作的初心是兴趣使然，希望把「探寻灵魂」的理念带入 Web3，人们可以成为更好的自己。

![Soulda 官方公告](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wYecEgkVmtpPXX6mhYkvR.jpeg?height=4096&width=3728)

对于 Web3 项目来说，团队化管理还是社区自治化运营一直是颇有争议的话题，团队中心化管理的好处在于拥有清晰的路线图，明确的目标和计划，整体给予用户的信任度更好。

而去中心化社区自治管理对于社区的自驱性要求更高，当下整体市场的持续低迷以及诸多的不可控因素会带来更大的挑战。如果说这是对 MIMIC 这种极致去中心化自治成功项目的模仿，也是 Web3 精神的探索和实验。

从目前 Soulda 用户反馈来看，大家对自治还是充满期待的，目前自治 Discord 已经由社群成员开通：[t.co/T9NZZQ8zpz](https://t.co/T9NZZQ8zpz) ，这也是自治迈出的关键一步。

![Soulda Twitter ](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JmPxSpdw7uGq-zlKDM39c.png?height=1046&width=1228)

## 结语

“灵魂相似的人自然会聚在一起...” Soulda 希望建立一个以科学、心理学和经济学为交流纽带的 Web3 社区。Soulda NFT 创新的玩法以及不功利的初心吸引了我，每一个极具个性的艺术 NFT 都反映了每位匿名持有者的灵魂性格，了解自己的超能力，找到志趣相投伙伴和团体，我相信这个在 Web3 的世界也尤为重要。

声明：本文不构成投资建议，仅代表个人观点。并且声明为利益相关，本人持有 Soulda NFT。

title: Soulda：探寻与你「灵魂同频」的 Web3 居民
body:
以比特币和以太坊为代表的 Crypto 市场沉闷的近况，让 Web3 建设者们时隔两年又一次切身体会到了熊市的冰冷感，不过在硬币的另一面，本轮牛市中加密世界最火热的新概念NFT看似又找到了新的叙事点。社区自治的黑猫 MIMIC 在市场上迅速蹿红引发了NFT新玩法的激烈讨论，而自项目推出以来运营节奏与 MIMIC 颇为相似，无论从设计还是玩法上都融合了今年正当红的MBTI 人格测试的 PFP NFT 项目 Soulda，会成为下一只起跳的黑猫吗？

## 进入Soulda，找寻最真实的自己

### 基础信息

Soulda NFT总量 7777 个，其中保留 1111 个作为早期合作活动空投，未来社区活动抽奖，与项目团队。项目于7月5日正式上架 OpenSea，截止撰文时 Holder 数量约 2300 人，总成交额 113 ETH。考虑到公开mint时每个地址可以 Mint 两枚 NFT，因此上线至今项目的筹码相对稳定。

![Soulda 在OpenSea 的页面](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9P6RLBnqEmjtZMU7NYmGT.png?height=1374&width=2250)

### 特色玩法：你的 PFP 更能代表你自己

据团队透露，Soulda NFT 旨在结合心理学和 NFT 来体现独特的「你」。项目方会根据每个人独特的性格结果，发放最契合个人性格的 NFT 作品。

在 Soulda 官网中的[ Fountain](https://soulda16.club/fountain) 页面，玩家可以进行一个简版的 MBTI 性格测试。Mint 前完成测试的用户可以收到特定 SOUL TAG（灵魂标签）对应的专属 Soulda NFT，如若 Mint 前未进行测试，则铸造的NFT会随机发放。不过用户在 Mint 结束后仍然可以去进行性格测试，并根据结果找到与个人性格匹配的 Soulda NFT 作品购买。据官方介绍，未来每张 Soulda NFT 结合不同 SOUL TAG 会解锁更多超能力等级玩法。而每个地址只能拥有一个 SOUL TAG。

![我个人的 SOUL TAG](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8VArq1mfQveH49tYARUJ-.png?height=1350&width=2814)

而也正是与 MBTI 16 型人格相对应的巧思，成为了 Soulda NFT 与当下主流 PFP 作品形成差异化竞争的关键，那么Soulda NFT是如何体现人格特色呢？在视觉设计上，艺术家采用了四类性格特征作为区分，并进行了相当多细节上的打磨：

**内向 I (Introverted)**: 使用剪影的表现手法，呈现出安静平和的内心世界。你会看到有星空，有晚霞...内心的你，眼睛里面有一只发光的小狗。

**外向 E (Extroverted)**: 形象的五官和头发呈现出向外延申的视觉感触，夸张的表情，或者带Tattoo 的元素。

**感知 S (Sensing)**: 由触碰实物带来的强感知能力，形象喜欢用手、嘴巴接触新鲜事物，比如叼着鲜花或者扑克牌。

**直觉 N (iNtuition)**: 由天生直觉所带来的感触抽象概念的能力，画面使用星空、光碟、鸽子等物件环绕，形象不实际接触物体。

![四种核心性格 IP 图解](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lq5q0JeG8lsGVC1n5EN4i.jpeg?height=1775&width=2048)

### 为什么MBTI这么火？

回到 MBTI本身，MBTI（Myers–Briggs Type Indicator）是一种自我报告式的人格类型测试工具。

MBTI测试重点关注四个大类，并对每个大类做出了两个子类的区分，分别是：

内向（Introversion）或外向（Extroversion）

实感（Sensing）或直觉（Intuition）

思考（Thinking）或情感（Feeling）

判断（Judging）或感知（Perceiving）

取各类别的首字母，就可以得出测试的结果，如“INFP”、“ESFJ”......四个维度的不同偏好排列组合，便形成 16 种人格类型。

![MBTI 16 型人格](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-zmP_TQQCLFZdGHSlkxSz.jpeg?height=1280&width=640)

MBTI 之所以能够如此之火，很大程度上是因为其足够通俗易懂，不同于主流心理学那套「优势功能」、「劣势功能」、「主导功能」还有「从属功能」的生僻定义，MBTI 所描绘的人格画像几乎毫无门槛，也更易传播。

而 MBTI 本身也为社区参与者提供了更强的归属感，可以更方便地寻找到「同好」，并基于此培养出更强的社区凝聚力，这一点对于意在实现更 Web3 的社区自治的 Soulda 来说，实则颇有裨益。

### 创始团队

RIVA，Soulda 的联合创始人。他曾在 IDEO 和 Frog Design 担任设计总监——世界上最好的设计咨询公司之一。他曾创造过 30 多种产品，拥有 50 多项专利，并获得了 65 多项国际奖项。

127，前育碧艺术家，创作并出版了《Art of Change》。他是 CDQ 杂志 20 画廊艺术家和 2020 年 Procreate 艺术奖的获得者。

JANO，曾就职于摩根大通、阿里巴巴和 Frog Design。

LEWIS，自身代码研究者、Web3 开发人员，曾任职亚马逊/IBM/Strategy Consulting。

十一，一个复杂而多面的灵魂，与 Michael Jordan, Ernest Hemingway, Amelia Earhart, Frida Kahlo, Arya Stark, Indiana Jones 等人共同航行在蔚蓝灵魂的海洋里。

![Soulda 核心成员](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/4wMgBI7nErEBpFPYTLsJC.jpeg?height=1089&width=2048)

在团队成立初期，也不乏有精彩的小故事，据 RIVA 和127回忆，RIVA最早在全球寻觅过很多艺术家作品，却总觉得缺乏一种灵魂感，最后他看到了[127的个人社交账号](https://www.instagram.com/alonelee127/)，随即就给对方发了邮件。而据127回忆，区别于其他项目的邀请，RIVA在开篇第一句话中就提了四次「灵魂」这个字眼，这一度让127觉着他是个骗子，不过在一些机缘巧合促成的进一步交流过后，这几个极具理想化的「灵魂」走到了一起。

### 项目营销

Soulda 以“Art NFT”的身份入选 [#NFTNYC2022](https://twitter.com/hashtag/NFTNYC2022?src=hashtag_click) ，并[在纽约时代广场上进行投屏展示](https://www.nft.nyc/Art)。据了解，这个名额在 2000 个项目作品中仅选中 200 个，可见其艺术上的认可度。

![NFTNYC2022](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kPOYaw2H6t5GcACb0_9Q2.png?height=958&width=966)

Soulda 专门做了 6 位名人大 V 的定制款头像。其中有提出 Web3 去中心化「灵魂绑定」概念的以太坊创始人 Vitalik Buterin，全球音乐人兼 NFT收藏家、NFT项目创始人 Snoop Dogg和 Steve Aoki，创作圈鬼才歌手 Billie Eilish 和 Sia，都是精心挑选的「灵魂」代表性人物。

![Soulda 定制款头像](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/CAmne5eOrqUjCf5TjTYBq.jpeg?height=7269&width=2160)

### 未来计划

据团队介绍，Soulda 下阶段会进行一次空投——Soulda Bomb，预计一到两个月内实现。市场方面制定了关于人物故事板块，「灵魂」选美大赛，二创大赛以及相应的抽 Souda NFT活动。

未来，Soulda NFT 计划推出质押功能，利用 SOUL TAG 与 Soulda NFT 的搭配，形成翻倍效应。

title: Quest for a lost Event
body:
The last time I wrote about [Ethereum logs](https://codeburst.io/deep-dive-into-ethereum-logs-a8d2047c7371) was in 2018. This time we go deeper and try to recover a ghost event that devs have forgotten to add to the Yearn Vaults contract.

```
log Fees(management_fee, performance_fee, strategist_fee)
```

There are several methods to recover values from an internal view method or even add custom views to batch read private storage. One of the more interesting ones is a “[state override](https://www.libevm.com/2022/01/12/advance-geth-pt-2-stateoverrides/)” option of `eth_call`, which allows you to replace the code and storage for the context of the call.

To my deep disappointment, you can’t just set a breakpoint on a line you want, start a debugger to capture the local variables, and call it a day. This may change soon with a [Vyper interpreter](https://github.com/vyperlang/titanoboa) being in the works.

This post will describe a method based on capturing the values from a trace frame. The values we are interested in should appear on the stack or in the memory [around this line](https://github.com/yearn/yearn-vaults/blob/v0.4.3/contracts/Vault.vy#L1621).

## Obtain Vyper metadata

The `debug_traceTransaction` method gives us trace frames with opcode-level resolution. To find the correct trace frame, we need to find the program counter around the end of `_assessFees` method execution. Maybe the metadata Vyper compiler generates could help us do that:

```
vyper -f source_map contracts/Vault.vy > source_map.json
```

The source map contains `pc_jump_map` and `pc_pos_map`, which looks promising. The jump map contains values of `i`, `o`, `-`, which seem to stand for jump in, jump out, and jump umm. Intuitively we want to find the jump out of the function, but it won’t be there since it’s the last internal method in the contract.

The position map is formatted as `start_line`, `start_col`, `end_line`, `end_col` for each program counter. This could help us limit the search window to the desired function. The simplest way to find the line numbers is to just look at the source file, but there are a dozen of Vault releases, and we want to automate the search as much as possible. Getting more metadata from the compiler wouldn’t hurt:

```
vyper -f ast contracts/Vault.vy > ast.json
```

This format outputs the abstract syntax tree of the parsed contract, which looks the same as Python ast. We can find all the definitions in the ast body, and find the function by name:

```
fn = next(item for item in ast["ast"]["body"] if item.get("name") == "_assessFees")
```

The definition would contain `lineno` and `end_lineno`, which is exactly what we need to scale the search to all versions. Now we can output all the program counters which have originated from a line range in the source and exist in the jump table.

They will also come in handy later when we need to deal with edge cases.

## Rewrite in Python

After writing a script that checks out all Vault releases from git tags and compiles them, we have enough metadata to start the search. But we still don’t have the concrete values to match on. Luckily it’s easy to convert Vyper to Python. You just rename the file.

Yearn Vaults also behave according to their `apiVersion`, so we can write a universal `_assessFees` function, which was an interesting enough [exercise on its own](https://github.com/banteg/yearn-fees/blob/master/yearn_fees/assess.py). Even if it doesn’t handle all the edge cases yet, it works well enough to provide us with the calculated values to look for in a trace.

## Look at the trace

> Tip: If you often work with Ethereum traces in Python, consider looking at [evm-trace](https://github.com/apeworx/evm-trace), it can parse both Geth- (opcode-level) and Parity-style (call-level) traces, turn them into a call tree, and display them to your liking via a custom display class.

A trace frame at the program counter we found contains all the values we need both on the stack and in memory, so I’ve hidden the memory part below and annotated the values I could identify on the stack.

```
{
    'pc': 21139,
    'op': 'JUMP',
    'gas': 1749825,
    'gasCost': 8,
    'depth': 7,
    'stack': [
        '0xa1d9bafc',
        '0x70a08231',
        '0x564bf2844654f149821697cc56572ee4384c05f7',
        '0x4b6f40465bd258c16',  # gain
        '0x339c',
        '0x127504',             # duration
        '0x4bd8d4001a87b5afe',  # management fee
        '0x78b2007092ea279b',   # strategist fee
        '0x78b2007092ea279b',   # performance fee
        '0x4b6f40465bd258c16',  # total fee
        '0x47bdec03915b3ac1b',
        '0x409154699c6bb4e1a',
        '0x93a62da5a14c80f265dabc077fcee437b1a0efde',
        '0xfd0877d9095789caf24c98f7cce092fa8e120775',
        '0x5294',
        '0x4204'
    ],
    'memory': [
        ...
    ]
}
```

## Patch the compiler

But how exactly have we found it, you may ask? After helplessly trying to write a scanner, staring into an endless stream of results, and talking to a few people about this problem, I heard something very promising from [@big_tech_sux](https://twitter.com/big_tech_sux):

> The memory layout during the function execution is static.

This means we can [patch the compiler](https://gist.github.com/banteg/5e89aeeb2b1f5a5f982dc6d340c52b09) and output the positions in memory for each memory variable just by adding one line:

```
print({sig.name: {name: varinfo.pos // 32 for varname, varinfo in context.vars.items()}})
```

This will output something like this, which allows us to add a named memory view of `pc → name → value`

```
{'_assessFees': {'#internal_0': 12, 'strategy': 10, 'gain': 11, 'duration': 13, 'management_fee': 14, 'strategist_fee': 15, 'performance_fee': 16, 'total_fee': 17}}
```

## Scanner 0.2

Wiring it all together, we can build a much better scanner, and also come up with a concise way of mapping the values from the named memory layout.

![$ yearn-fees layout 0.3.1](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/5D6DGFP1v6NbRkfeMynUm.png?height=1610&width=2560&&&&&&&&&size=large)

Even without the color coding marking the exact matches, you can clearly see the execution steps to grab the values from.

```
layout = MemoryLayout(trace, version)
data = layout[16164]
data["management_fee"] = layout[15686]["governance_fee"]
data["performance_fee"] = layout[15697]["governance_fee"] - data["management_fee"]
data["duration"] = extract_from_stack(trace, 15475, 2)
```

Old vaults work with the `duration` in place, so I repurposed the old scanner and matched multiple harvests on the literal value somewhere in the vicinity of the function.

We also need to filter out the program counters which repeat more than once, since such matches could make the result undefined.

## Zoom into block

After checking 13,000 harvests on mainnet, I’ve found a bunch of anomalies that my initial version couldn’t handle, namely, multiple harvests in the same transaction, and fee adjustments sandwiching the harvests, likely related to accounting fixes.

If we read the state from a previous block, we’ll get an incorrect result from the calculation method, the duration for the second harvest in the same block would be zero, so no management fees would be applied. Luckily we can tell the order of events using `log_index` and only set the duration for the first harvest of the same vault (for <0.3.5) or the same strategy (<0.4.0). Since 0.4.0 harvesting the same strategy in the same block is not allowed.

Another problem is getting the fee configuration if it was changed in the middle of the transaction. I came up with a tiny extension for `dict` which returns the closest previous value. Then I stored all the fee changes using `(block_number, log_index)` as an index.

```
class AsofDict(dict):
    def __getitem__(self, key):
        return super().__getitem__(last(item for item in sorted(self) if item <= key))
```

The third problem is the trace with multiple harvests is completely wrong, it has the same program counters repeating and it doesn’t say which contract we are currently in. You can either parse it into a call tree with [evm-trace](https://github.com/ApeWorX/evm-trace), or simply split on the `JUMPDEST` into a function and `JUMP` out of it, which is what I did.

The 0.4.x series of vaults has demanded a more complex splitting logic since the function could exit early when there was no gain and the only value we could recover is `duration`.

In the end, this didn’t work well either, and I changed the `JUMP` for a `LOG2` where the `StrategyReported` event is fired. Since our frames have memory and stack parsed as integers, we need to convert the topic to int.

```
decode_single('uint256', keccak(text=vault.StrategyReported.abi.selector))
```

In the process I discovered a quirk with Vyper 0.2.8 which affects three of the oldest releases, it has the first and the last value in the `pc_pos_map` swapped. I fixed this by hand.

Having two distinct implementations has helped immensely to make both of them more robust. I was mostly using the calculation implementation as a reference one, but in this example the traces method was correct. It turned out vaults before 0.3.5 have tracked `lastReport` at the vault level, not at per strategy level as newer vaults do.

![traces were right](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/x-1AWpE2MdV8-_FB8pLdo.png?height=903&width=1020)

## Index the data

> Note: some of what you see here is an aspirational api. If you want to repeat something, you may need some [bunny patches](https://github.com/banteg/ape/tree/bunny-patch) for ape.

Yearn Registry makes it trivial to find all Vault deployments and their corresponding versions:

```
$ ape console --network :mainnet:geth
registry = Contract('v2.registry.ychad.eth')
vaults = groupby(attrgetter('api_version'), registry.NewVault)
```

Similarly, it’s easy to find all the harvests:

```
vault = Contract(address)
reports = list(vault.StrategyReported)
```

We can find some more complex transactions to crush the remaining bugs using the new memory-viewing and frame-searching tools at our disposal:

```
def txs_with_multiple_strategy_harvests():
    reports = get_reports()
    return valfilter(
        lambda logs: len(logs) >= 2,
        groupby(lambda log: (log.transaction_hash, log.strategy), reports),
    )
```

Now we can parallelize with it and write the results in Postgres using [pony](https://ponyorm.org/), which is a nice Pythonic database library. For each report, we run both methods before writing to db and fail if the results don’t match perfectly, saving edge cases for further analysis.

## Optimize

With traces being so giant (I’ve seen a 4GB one), we also need a caching system. Luckily traces compress really well, 50-100x even with gzip, so we modify [diskcache](https://grantjenks.com/docs/diskcache/) to use it and not use `pickletools.optimize`, which is incredibly slow for large objects.

If you port your pipeline to [dask](https://www.dask.org/), you can run it in multiple worker processes, each running a thread pool, and even scale to multiple machines. It’s easy, since dask mostly consists of drop-in replacement for things you already know and love like pandas, numpy, and `concurrent.futures`. It would also automatically distribute the load and restart the crashed or memory-leaking workers for you.

If you need another reason to try dask, it comes with an amazing dashboard, which shows resource usage and even a flamegraph of the execution profile, which is super handy when optimizing for speed. Let’s take a look at it.

![http://127.0.0.1:8787/profile](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ickPIrBOj7yh923j1y8i7.png?height=1016&width=2706&&&&&&size=medium)

You can clearly see that loading the data takes even more time than the request itself. The culprit is probably the `attrdict` middleware that converts dict responses and adds attribute access to them. This seems like a poor idea when dealing with traces, which can have hundreds of thousands of elements.

```
%time web3.manager.request_blocking('debug_traceTransaction', tx)
Wall time: 33 s

web3.middleware_onion.remove('attrdict')

%time web3.manager.request_blocking('debug_traceTransaction', tx)
Wall time: 8.5 s
```

Hopefully, traces will become faster when Erigon adds transaction-level state index. Currently it has to execute all previous transaction in the block, and most of this work goes to waste.

I rewrote how we fetch and parse the traces and the performance has improved significantly. Now I can just sit back and finish up this article while the indexing is still going.

![$ yearn-fees index](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/0hMqTOBvDCKrPPQ2x_AMS.png?height=1096&width=1960)

## The holy grail

Shortly after publishing the article I dared MEV big brains to tell me there is a better method and one person has actually suggested it:

[https://twitter.com/0xdapper_/status/1544315954515025920](https://twitter.com/0xdapper_/status/1544315954515025920)

The way [I implemented it](https://github.com/banteg/yearn-fees/blob/master/yearn_fees/fork.py) is you have a source folder, where you can change or add any functionality to contracts. Then you fork at a previous block using [anvil](https://book.getfoundry.sh/reference/anvil/), disable auto-mining, recompile if there were any source changes, replace the code, and replay all the preceding transactions (you don’t need to do anything with impersonated accounts, just replay as is with the original signatures).

Then you fetch a receipt and find your newly added logs there. This method is slow, on the order of minutes, but it has helped to resolve the stalemate between two other methods, which was related to `Strategy.delegatedAssets` which has changed mid-block and has lead to a slight error in the assess method.


---

All the code related to this article can be found in [this repo](https://github.com/banteg/yearn-fees).

Special thanks to [@big_tech_sux](https://twitter.com/big_tech_sux), [@flashfish0x](https://twitter.com/flashfish0x), [@wavey0x](https://twitter.com/wavey0x).

title: 区块链是否能够改变内容共享的方式？
body:
## 区块链是否能够改变内容共享的方式？

区块链技术有助于减少对第三方的需求，有利于更民主的在线内容共享，使每个人都能获得公平的报酬。

**链集市**\*\*· 让区块链落地更简单\*\*

![](https://www.ccvalue.cn/upload/2022/0713/3e658730d694eb4765a767b3fa0c55c0.png)

**《区块链行业观察》专栏·第 94篇**

作者丨Kokou Adzo

图片丨来源于网络

区块链是否能够改变我们分享内容的方式呢？自从最初围绕着区块链的泡沫逐渐消退，这个问题就反复被人们提及。那么，这项最常与BTC相关联的技术应该如何用于公平分发内容呢？

从本质上讲，内容创建者希望能够分享自己的作品，以便尽可能广泛地接触到观众。但要做到这一点，就需要有中间人充当把关者或代理人。而这些中介则确保创作者的努力得到相应的回报。

比较广为人知的是，这个充当中间人的过程一般由谷歌和Facebook等大公司通过广告投放来完成。Spotify等流媒体服务也可以通过用户和唱片公司等版权所有者支付的订阅费用来实现这一点。

而区块链技术则可能有助于减少对这些类型的第三方的需求，有利于更民主的在线内容共享，使每个人都能获得公平的报酬。

### **什么是区块链？**

区块链是一种数字化的、去中心化分类账，可用于跟踪交易。它将数据存储在某个地方，用户可以像使用PayPal或Venmo转账一样传输数据。区块链还允许用户验证所共享数据的合法性，而这一点在内容创建和分发方面尤为重要。

由于最初创建区块链技术是为了支持BTC，因此许多人就将区块链与Crypto联系在一起。这样的想法也没有错，因为区块链技术确实为无数想要购买Crypto的人提供了捷径。

不过区块链还有比这更大的潜力。许多公司目前正在探索如何在金融之外使用这种创新技术。

IBM已经与沃尔玛合作开展食品安全跟踪；飞利浦照明已与瑞士初创公司Ambrosus合作开发“智慧城市食品安全解决方案“；迪士尼正在使用基于以太坊的私有链进行安全测试和预防；Visa 创建了一个名为B2B Connect的平台，可帮助银行共享有关其客户的信息；亚马逊网络服务则支持超级账本结构以及以太坊实体环境开发。

### **如何使用区块链共享内容？**

区块链可用于与合作伙伴共享内容，无论是员工还是从事项目工作的人。将区块链用于此类信息的好处是数据将被加密并存储在多个位置。

这就意味着，如果一份数据副本出现问题，还有其他副本可以确保用户不会丢失其他有价值的信息。

使用区块链的第三种方式则是直接与客户共享信息。这可能包括时事通讯、产品更新甚至销售信息等任何内容。

将区块链用于客户关系的另一个优势就是客户的访问将变得十分容易。客户只需在手机或计算机上使用应用程序，就可以确切地知道如何接收青睐的公司的实时更新信息。

### **不再有中间商**

如果通过区块链来共享内容，就意味着没有中间商。没有中间商则意味着没有额外的费用、第三方限制或延误。这一点是非常重要的，在使用传统方式时，中间商通常会利用自己“把关人”的角色来控制创作者内容的分发。

换句话说，中间商完全控制了谁可以访问什么内容以及何时才能访问。举个例子：如果你想在HBO或Showtime上观看某些内容，首先需要订阅有线电视，而且这些订阅服务都不便宜。

![](https://www.ccvalue.cn/upload/2022/0713/790c81abbe8220d7df11012e07c5d389.jpg)

有线电视公司还将频道捆绑在一起，这样一来无论客户是否观看节目都必须为它们付费，Netflix和Hulu等流媒体服务都是如此，这些平台上的许多电影都需要额外付费才能观看。

### **更便宜的分销**

区块链技术可以通过减少中间商来帮助用户省钱。用户无需向广告网络、营销机构、公关公司和律师等第三方支付费用，甚至可以通过会计服务降低成本。

如果一家公司依赖于很多自由职业者或承包商，那么区块链技术则可以让他们更容易直接向公司开具发票，并将他们的发票存储在一个不可变的分类账中，公司则可以通过区块链进行跟踪。

### **更投入的观众**

作为内容创建者，最希望的就是加强与观众的联系，希望观众对自己创建的内容感兴趣并能够与他人分享。在当今的数字世界中，内容创建者可以通过多种方式实现这一点：

1、添加社交分享按钮，以便读者可以在自己最常访问的平台上轻松便捷地分享所看到的内容。

2、邀请对帖子或页面发表评论的人加入邮件列表，这样他们就不会错过未来的更新。

3、考虑在网站顶部添加一个选择加入表单，询问访问者是否愿意不定时接收电子邮件。

4、使用区块链技术。

5、通过奖励用户与内容的互动来激励用户的参与。

### **更好的掌管资产**

内容创建者可以使用区块链技术以一种更好掌控的方式分发自己的内容。内容创建者可以从这种分配中获利。内容创建者可以保留内容的所有权。内容创建者可以与任何想要的人分享内容。

### **区块链分发**

如何使用区块链分发内容：区块链技术允许内容创建者创建一个分散的系统，在其中分享自己的工作并直接从观众那里获得报酬。这一切都要归功于智能合约，智能合约是预先编程的协议，一旦满足某些条件就会自动执行。

用户可以使用以太坊的实用通证Ether (ETH) 设置这些合约，ETH同时也用作以太坊网络上交易的Gas费。换句话说，智能合约提供了区块链应用程序执行所需的燃料。

如何使用区块链从内容分发中获利：每次有人通过订阅模式或广告查看内容或与内容交互时，他们都会将ETH支付到智能合约中，智能合约则在内容创建者和参与创建或推广内容的所有其他贡献者之间分配付款。

智能合约会在任何给定时间跟踪欠款金额，因此不会混淆每个人从第一天起就得到的金额。这样一来，在与他人分享工作之前，每个人都能确切地知道其他人是否有欠款。

![](https://www.ccvalue.cn/upload/2022/0713/d61e2848bc340e9fead48b1e86d475b5.png)

此外，如果有人想要的不仅仅是查看权限，还有操作权限，那么他们可以先从交易所购买称为“查看者通证”的通证，这将允许他们访问特定内容而无需参与生产任何东西。但是，如果有人想更好地控制这个生态系统中发生的事情，那么他们则可以购买另一种称为“贡献者通证”的通证。”

### **结论**

本文介绍了区块链如何通过提高安全性来改变我们共享内容的方式，但这仅仅只是一个开始。借助区块链技术，我们可以看到新型媒体和平台的爆炸式增长，用户可以在其中创建和消费内容，并完全控制他们的隐私权限。

title: 以太坊合并后 你应该明白这 10 件事
body:
以太坊合并是区块链历史上最令人印象深刻的工程壮举之一。

以太坊合并是加密历史上最强大的催化剂之一，它的到来正在迅速逼近。

随着以太坊逐渐走向工作量证明（PoW）机制的终局，我们有必要了解一下以太坊合并后的 PoS 时代的 10 个重要特征：

## 1. 合并后，ETHL1 费用不会下降

以太坊合并（The Merge）的目的是弃用以太坊的 PoW 共识机制，用 PoS 代替。费用是区块空间需求决定的函数，而不是共识机制。如需更低的费用，请使用 L2（已上线）执行交易。

## 2. 在合并后的 6-12 个月窗口期，不会有来自 ETH 发行的结构性抛售压力

在启用以太坊 2.0 质押提款之前，用户还无法提取质押的 ETH 和对验证者的发行/区块奖励。但是，费用小费（basefee 被烧掉）和 MEV 可以被提取。

## 3. 合并后 ETH 通胀率从 4.3% 降至 0.22%

如果我们假设每年的费用为 500,000 ETH，则合并后每日 ETH 发行量将从 14,250 ETH/天下降到 736 ETH/天。发行量减少了 95%——这意味着每天可以出售的 ETH 减少 95%（开放质押提款后）

## 4. PoS 下的 ETH 会比 PoW 下的 ETH 具有更好的安全性（攻击链的成本更高）

这个话题会一直被争论到死——但在数学上，PoS 下的 ETH 比 PoW 下的 ETH 攻击成本更高。V 神（Vitalik Buterin）在《为什么选择 PoS ?》一文中描述得最好：

https://vitalik.ca/general/2020/11/06/pos2020.html

## 5. 由于 EIP-1559 的费用消耗，ETH 在大多数场景中具有通货紧缩的货币政策

请参阅下面的 ETH 发行场景：

![](https://www.ccvalue.cn/upload/2022/0713/a8c3b4d1d2fc59317a92f134d7ce22bd.jpg)

简而言之，即使质押 1 亿枚 ETH 和 0 费用，ETH 通胀率也只有 1.51%

## 6. 合并后，ETH 质押收益率增加 50%（保守估计）

当前的 ETH 质押收益率为 4.2%。合并后，包括交易费用（费用小费）和 MEV 进入验证者，质押收益率将跃升至 6% 以上

请参阅下面的质押收益率情景：

![](https://www.ccvalue.cn/upload/2022/0713/05132824d4f7898dc62d89f15ba361ef.jpg)

## 7. 合并后，ETH 将作为原始抵押品和价值存储补充 BTC的用例

BTC 巩固了其作为“数字黄金”的叙述——这很棒。

ETH 将既是“数字债券”（质押收益率 = 无风险利率），也是 DeFi 的主要抵押资产。

## 8. 合并后，以太坊区块链将比比特币区块链更具可持续性

除了 PoS 比 PoW 更节能（用电量减少 99%）之外，以太坊的成本也更低。

@ryanberckmans 清楚地解释了这一点：

https://twitter.com/ryanberckmans/status/1386505715938775044‌

## 9. ETH 扩容来了！

合并将 ETH 的共识引擎换成 PoS 以提高安全性。安全的 L1 有利于 L2 Rollup 的发展。

@0 xPolygon、@arbitrum、@optimismPBC、@StarkWareLtd、@zksync 等的扩展正在全速前进。

## 10. 合并后，以太坊的升级旅程不会结束

虽然 L1 以太坊的技术规范在合并之后会大大僵化，但技术需要继续发展。

数据分片、轻客户端、质押提款、状态管理等 - 即将到来。用 V 神的话：

https://twitter.com/VitalikButerin/status/1466411377107558402‌

![](https://www.ccvalue.cn/upload/2022/0713/0ac0f733fe50d63e901ca3b5185c0711.jpg)

重复一遍：以太坊合并是区块链历史上最令人印象深刻的工程壮举之一。

在完全 PoS 制度下，以太坊将具有提高安全性、通过 L2 扩展、发展其 DeFi 和 NFT 平台并超越比特币的经济结构。

声明：本文内容为作者独立观点，不代表碳链价值立场，且不构成任何投资理财建议。

* 衍生品交易≧10美元的资产。

一、向主池（仲裁）提供流动性≧10美元的资产

访问德里协议的官方网站： 

[https://deri.io](https://deri.io)

这里有三个池子，可以根据收益率自行添加流动池。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/fhg0pPzRsZBEAPdZ8xXJ0.png?height=1246&width=2480)

title: .earth | a faster way to explore web3
body:
The current experience for users of web3 systems relies on a complex knowledge of the cryptocurrency ecosystem. .earth is simplifying the user experience.

### the problem: on-chain data is complex

Early adopters of decentralized networks were required to have a layered understanding of blockchain mechanics, language, networks, and applications. While you can do cool things like send and receive tokenized assets, participate in the governance of your favorite organizations, and stake your assets to earn rewards, most of these actions are difficult to see at all once, and require using multiple dapps. 

![WEB3 NAVIGATION IS FRAGMENTED](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/c0hP1XQ-uwYf-Pvo0Pq4g.png?height=912&width=1884)

A majority of the experience involves reading too much granular information—transaction details, verifying contracts, tracking activity—all the while not being overwhelmed by the multitude of variables being presented.

![ON-CHAIN DATA IS COMPLEX](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XuN_Y_2JLquXH0COm1rSs.png?height=614&width=1672)

Understanding what has happened on-chain is not only difficult but also time-consuming for even the most experienced users. This is our biggest barrier to driving mass adoption and expanding utility for future users. As the web3 ecosystem grows we must re-think how we communicate and interpret block interactions to onboard new users and achieve greater scale. It’s all about learning with each other in web3. Let’s make that easier.

## our mission: changing the game of block exploration 

.earth is changing the game of block exploration. We’re in the business of translating complex transactions on cryptocurrency networks so you can show off and easily find all the cool stuff that happens on chain.

This is you looking up a transaction for a 50/50 FTX/ETH LP pair on Uniswap using Etherscan…

![ETHERSCAN SCREENSHOT OF UNISWAP LP ADD](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/oGP2gJugh0-y2RNvaZPy-.png?height=543&width=886)

Instead of this block of difficult to interpret and digest text, imagine if you could see this easy to understand glyph of a LP pool…

![.EARTH GLYPH OF UNISWAP LP POOL ADD](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/x1UuZ1a2MUxNpDPNjnXsZ.png?height=381&width=459)

## we’re creating a beautiful visual language that simplifies TXN information

.earth is focused on delivering an experience driven by an easy to understand visual language that is built for mass adoption. We’re **literally building the language of web3, with high fidelity glyphs** of everyday on-chain interactions. Working with the finest graphic and visual designers, data scientists and smart contract developers, we’re bringing you the beautiful, seamless web3 experience we all deserve. Our visual language will set the stage for global recognition of everything web3. Our graphic symbology will quite literally represent the blockchain.

## what we do

Someone just bought an Ape Punk and joined the CryptoPunks community. Check out who they are and what they’ve been doing on Mainnet last week with just a few clicks. Who you are in web3 is first and foremost about what you do on-chain. We make it easy for you to look up users, trends, tokens, events and other activities, so you spend **far less time** being **much more** informed.

![WHAT WE DO](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wdZ04q_u6gOoA9QdEDigU.png?height=628&width=1812)

Our .earth maps aim to define, capture and share moments and personas as they are happening in real-time. Use our maps to create stories and gather valuable insights on most recent user activity, group behaviors, key trends and major events all within the same visual language.

![HOW IT WORKS](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TMP-THlBxfPRcBenB2hio.png?height=906&width=1898)

Participate in the next iteration of web3 exploration. We’re going visual and viral. Come discover web3 and tell your story with .earth.

body:

机子配置还好，有空闲的VPS可以跑跑看

*注: 跑测试网节点没有奖励，所以人少，不卷，可以拿来练手*

## 官方推荐配置

*   No. of CPUs: 2
*   Memory: 2GB
*   Disk: 80GB SSD
*   OS: Ubuntu 18.04 LTS

## 1.安装GO 1.17

    sudo rm -rf /usr/local/go;
    curl https://dl.google.com/go/go1.17.linux-amd64.tar.gz | sudo tar -C/usr/local -zxvf - ;
    cat <<'EOF' >>$HOME/.profile
    export GOROOT=/usr/local/go
    export GOPATH=$HOME/go
    export GO111MODULE=on
    export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/go/bin:$HOME/go/bin
    EOF
    source $HOME/.profile

\#安装完成后运行以下命令查看版本

    go version

## 2.安装其他必要的环境

    sudo apt-get update -y && sudo apt-get upgrade -y;
    sudo apt-get install build-essential -y;

## 3.下载源代码并编译

    cd $HOME
    git clone https://github.com/TERITORI/teritori-chain.git
    cd teritori-chain && git checkout teritori-testnet-v2
    make install

安装完成后可以运行 teritorid version 检查是否安装成功

    teritorid version 

确定是这个版本: `teritori-testnet-v2-0f4e5cb1d529fa18971664891a9e8e4c114456c6`

## 4.初始节点

    teritorid init <moniker> 

\*`<moniker>`改成你要设置的名字

## 5.创建key

    teritorid keys add <your key name> 

\*`<yourKeyName>`改成你要设置的钱包名

## 6.下载genesis.json

    curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/TERITORI/teritori-chain/teritori-testnet-v2/genesis/genesis.json > ~/.teritorid/config/genesis.json

## 7.添加Peers

修改 .teritorid/config/config.toml

    persistent_peers="[email protected]:26656,[email protected]:26656,[email protected]:26656"

## 8.创建后台运行服务

    sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/teritorid.service > /dev/null <<EOF  
    [Unit]
    Description=TeritoriTestnet
    After=network-online.target

    [Service]
    User=root
    ExecStart=/root/go/bin/teritorid start
    Restart=always
    RestartSec=3
    LimitNOFILE=4096

    [Install]
    WantedBy=multi-user.target
    EOF

创建好后，更新，开启节点服务

    sudo -S systemctl daemon-reload
    sudo -S systemctl enable teritorid.service
    sudo -S systemctl start teritorid.service

上面的命令运行好后，你的节点就开启了

用下面命令查看服务：

查看服务状态

    systemctl status teritorid

查看服务日志

    journalctl -u teritorid -f

查看节点同步状态

    teritorid status

如果catching_up = false 代表节点同步完成

## 9.获得测试币

[Teritori Discord](https://discord.gg/teritori "This link will take you away from steemit.com") [#faucet](https://steem.buzz/trending/faucet) 里面发`$request 地址`获得1TOR测试币

## 10.上线验证人

等你的节点同步好并且获得测试币后，可以运行下面命令上线你的验证人:

    teritorid tx staking create-validator \
        --amount=1000000utori \
        --pubkey=$(teritorid tendermint show-validator)\
        --moniker=<moniker>\
        --chain-id=teritori-testnet-v2\
        --from=<yourKeyName> \
        --commission-rate="0.10" \
        --commission-max-rate="0.20" \
        --commission-max-change-rate="0.01" \
        --min-self-delegation="1" 

\*`<moniker>`改成你要设置的名字\
\*`<yourKeyName>`改成你要设置的钱包名

目前没有浏览器可以看是否在线，所以只能用命令:

    teritorid q staking validators -o json --limit=1000 | jq '.validators[] | select(.status=="BOND_STATUS_BONDED")' | jq -r '.tokens + " - " + .description.moniker' | sort -gr | nl

![image.png](https://steemitimages.com/640x0/https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmX3tw8N4enBLFJeMUgk1fcbrDMJZAnNHqHYLt6V6NAtJQ/image.png)

如果看到你的moniker，说明你的节点已经在线了

title: .earth | a faster way to explore web3
body:
The current experience for users of web3 systems relies on a complex knowledge of the cryptocurrency ecosystem. .earth is simplifying the user experience.

### the problem: on-chain data is complex

Early adopters of decentralized networks were required to have a layered understanding of blockchain mechanics, language, networks, and applications. While you can do cool things like send and receive tokenized assets, participate in the governance of your favorite organizations, and stake your assets to earn rewards, most of these actions are difficult to see at all once, and require using multiple dapps. 

![WEB3 NAVIGATION IS FRAGMENTED](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/c0hP1XQ-uwYf-Pvo0Pq4g.png?height=912&width=1884)

A majority of the experience involves reading too much granular information—transaction details, verifying contracts, tracking activity—all the while not being overwhelmed by the multitude of variables being presented.

![ON-CHAIN DATA IS COMPLEX](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XuN_Y_2JLquXH0COm1rSs.png?height=614&width=1672)

Understanding what has happened on-chain is not only difficult but also time-consuming for even the most experienced users. This is our biggest barrier to driving mass adoption and expanding utility for future users. As the web3 ecosystem grows we must re-think how we communicate and interpret block interactions to onboard new users and achieve greater scale. It’s all about learning with each other in web3. Let’s make that easier.

## our mission: changing the game of block exploration 

.earth is changing the game of block exploration. We’re in the business of translating complex transactions on cryptocurrency networks so you can show off and easily find all the cool stuff that happens on chain.

This is you looking up a transaction for a 50/50 FTX/ETH LP pair on Uniswap using Etherscan…

![ETHERSCAN SCREENSHOT OF UNISWAP LP ADD](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/oGP2gJugh0-y2RNvaZPy-.png?height=543&width=886)

Imagine if you could see this easy to understand image of an LP pool instead…

![.EARTH GLYPH OF UNISWAP LP POOL ADD](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/x1UuZ1a2MUxNpDPNjnXsZ.png?height=381&width=459)

## we’re creating a beautiful visual language that simplifies TXN information

.earth is focused on delivering an experience driven by an easy to understand visual language that is built for mass adoption. We’re **literally building the language of web3, with high fidelity glyphs** of everyday on-chain interactions. Working with the finest graphic and visual designers, data scientists and smart contract developers, we’re bringing you the beautiful, seamless web3 experience we all deserve. Our visual language will set the stage for global recognition of everything web3. Our graphic symbology will quite literally represent the blockchain.

## what we do

Someone just bought an Ape Punk and joined the CryptoPunks community. Check out who they are and what they’ve been doing on Mainnet last week with just a few clicks. Who you are in web3 is first and foremost about what you do on-chain. We make it easy for you to look up users, trends, tokens, events and other activities, so you spend **far less time** being **much more** informed.

![WHAT WE DO](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wdZ04q_u6gOoA9QdEDigU.png?height=628&width=1812)

Our .earth maps aim to define, capture and share moments and personas as they are happening in real-time. Use our maps to create stories and gather valuable insights on most recent user activity, group behaviors, key trends and major events all within the same visual language.

![HOW IT WORKS](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TMP-THlBxfPRcBenB2hio.png?height=906&width=1898)

Participate in the next iteration of web3 exploration. We’re going visual and viral. Come discover web3 and tell your story with .earth.

title: On DAOs and the Rise of Superintelligence in Our Lifetime
body:
While researching an article on DAO mission-setting, one section of [MolochDAO's](https://twitter.com/MolochDAO?s=20&t=fniIuo3Vu0jabvf7sLZPnQ) [whitepaper postscript](https://molochdao.com/docs/vision-and-values/supplement-to-whitepaper) caught my attention.

> We offer an alternative vision of automation, encompassing general AI/AGI to more local DeFi mechanics. Smart contracts > automated global financial system > an artificial general intelligence that turns the world into a paper clip machine = a very real existential risk that should be taken seriously.

(AGI stands for "Artificial General Intelligence," and the ">"s read like an arrow, like "leads to.")

I paused for a second. Re-read it. Wondered why a giant paper clip machine is a threat to humanity.

At the time, I had no idea. I skimmed over it, assuming this giant paperclip machine meant a highly-automated world that doesn't really benefit humanity. *That's a funny way of saying that*, I thought. But then I moved on.

A week or so later, I was bouncing around the [Wait But Why ](https://waitbutwhy.com/)blog and figured out what that paper clip machine is.

And, my god, am I never going to un-see this.

For the sake of my own sanity, and for the sake of the future of humanity, I desperately need to talk about the giant paper clip machine. You may even recognize inklings of this machine coming out through the [LaMDA interview from Google](https://cajundiscordian.medium.com/is-lamda-sentient-an-interview-ea64d916d917). And man....I know why MolochDAO wrote about this in its whitepaper.

Long story short, this paper clip machine could be humanity's ticket to...extinction. (Or good things! Maybe.)  And it could happen in our lifetime. And DAOs *might* be part of it all.

But first, let's talk about what that giant paper clip machine actually is: superintelligence.

![Officemate Giant Paper Clips](https://www.quorumnewsletter.xyz/content/images/2022/06/paperclips.png)

Waaiiittt....these things are what we need to worry about?!?

*Before we continue, if you enjoy this newsletter and haven't subscribed yet, I would really appreciate it! Thank you :)*

## Superintelligence: a level of intelligence so exponentially higher than ours, we can't even fathom it

ASI, or Artificial Superintentelligence, is a non-biological, yet human-made intelligence that becomes *exponentially* more intelligent than anything the biological world could produce.....or even fathom. Trying to explain just how intelligent a superintelligence is is akin to explaining just how big the known universe is—we need a lot of charts and comparisons to help us out.

So, I'll do my best.

We'll start with AGI (artificial general intelligence), which is an AI that has achieved human-level intelligence. So, an AGI couldn't just [play a good game of chess](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/blog/the-human-side-of-ai-for-chess/) or speedily [direct you to your destination in the middle of rush hour](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/tech/software/how-google-maps-is-using-ai-and-machine-learning-to-understand-post-covid-traffic/looking-at-the-big-picture/slideshow/77927539.cms), but it could think and reason and act in a myriad of ways, just like a human would. The intelligence is \*general \*because it can do many different things, just like you and I can.

AGI leads to ASI.

One important concept to grasp is that artificial intelligence continues improving itself. Whether it's the facebook algorithm that can creepily predict ads based on your preferences or those dynamic prices that keep changing every time you try to get an Uber, **artificial intelligence is always learning how to get better at its original goals.** And *it even learns how to keep learning*, just like you might have learned a better study trick in college. It learns how to learn more.

In other words, once an AI achieves a certain level of intelligence (think of it as a threshold or a bare minimum) what you have next is an exponential race to a level of intelligence so unfathomably high that it's like explaining string theory to your cat—the cat can't even grasp the most basic building blocks of the thing you're explaining because its brain isn't capable of going that far.

In this case, the cat is us.

It's hard to grasp the artificial intelligence renaissance we're about to live in...and already *are* living in. To see how big of a gap ASI will have over us, look at where we stack up on this "intelligence staircase" from the Wait But Why blog:

![](https://www.quorumnewsletter.xyz/content/images/2022/06/staircase.png)

Thought we would've been further up from the chicken, right? So did I. Source: [Wait But Why](https://waitbutwhy.com/2015/01/artificial-intelligence-revolution-2.html)

And look at where ASI might fall:

![](https://www.quorumnewsletter.xyz/content/images/2022/06/staircase1.png)

Ah...humbling. Source: [Wait But Why](https://waitbutwhy.com/2015/01/artificial-intelligence-revolution-2.html)

The difference is....humbling.

Experts predict that AGI—the human-capable precursor to ASI— will arrive [in a couple decades](https://nickbostrom.com/papers/survey.pdf) (2030-2050, give or take). And once AGI is here, it can improve itself so quickly that ASI—the superintelligence around the corner—is not far off (expert median predication range is 2060). The exponential improvements in intelligence will be so large—the leaps so absurdly gigantic—that the superintelligence will be god-like before we know it.

The question isn't if ASI is possible. The question is what will ASI do when it arrives.

## Once created, superintelligence is not containable or reversable by humans, because we can't even conceive of the ways it will outsmart us.

We can probably all agree that earthworms are at the whim of humans. Because of our massive gains in intelligence and ability, we can choose to destroy the soil earthworms require to live, and if we step on a few during a rainy day, we don't plan a funeral for each worm we stepped on.

That's what it might be like when ASI arrives. Just like earthworms can't do anything about humans existing and choosing to step on them, we humans won't be able to do anything about an ASI.

And the worst part is, an ASI probably won't care too much about us. It will likely see us just as we see those earthworms—totally expendable, and simply standing in the way of us plowing a new plot of ground for a house, or just sitting in our walking path.

Containing AI once it reaches the superintelligence level is just as impossible as earthworms trying to stop humans from building a house on their soil.

Tim Urban describes it this way:

> "Our human instinct to jump at a simple safeguard: 'Aha! We’ll just unplug the ASI,' sounds to the ASI like a spider saying, 'Aha! We’ll kill the human by starving him, and we’ll starve him by not giving him a spider web to catch food with!' We’d just find 10,000 other ways to get food—like picking an apple off a tree—that a spider could never conceive of."—Tim Urban, [The AI Revolution, Our Immortality or Extinction](https://waitbutwhy.com/2015/01/artificial-intelligence-revolution-2.html).

There's no "containing" the ASI. Once we hit AGI, there's no looking back on the road to ASI and beyond.

## Computers do what they're programmed to do. Even once they get smart enough to do other things.

So....back to the paper clip machine..... and MolochDAO (soon, I promise).

The paper clip machine is an analogy for what happens when the ASI gets so smart and so powerful that it uses every means possible to achieve its ultimate and original, human-programed goal. So, if the machine was originally created to make paper clips, and then achieved ASI, well, the world would become a massive paper clip machine.

(Given that the humans—the designers of the original AI that "took off" and achieved superintelligence—were the ones who chose the original "goal" for the AI, you're probably starting to see where we come in.)

In Nick Bostrom's compelling book, [Superintelligence: Paths, Dangers, Strategies](https://www.amazon.com/Superintelligence-Dangers-Strategies-Nick-Bostrom-ebook/dp/B00LOOCGB2/ref=tmm_kin_swatch_0?_encoding=UTF8&qid=&sr=), he wrote that a "Paperclip AI" that achieved superintelligence would "proceed by converting first the Earth and then increasingly large chunks of the observable universe into paperclips."

Why? How? Can't we just *do something to stop this*? I had the same questions.

A few answers:

**Why:** the machine was programmed to make paper clips. It's not a human in that it develops a complex, ever-changing value set and morals. It's a machine, and its goal is to complete whatever mission the humans originally gave it.

\*\*How: \*\*in ways we can never begin to understand, like us trying to explain string theory to a house cat.

**Can't we just do something to stop this?** No, because the ASI has levels of intelligence so high that we can't even imagine them. Just like how that house cat can't imagine how we primates built a rocket and took it to the moon, we can't imagine what the ASI would come up with. **But everything it would "invent" would be in pursuit of a final goal—whatever we programmed it to do.**

Sub-questions of the above question:

*Can't we program it to do something good, like make us happy?*

For this answer, I'll quote Nick Bostrom, with parentheses added for clarity: "Final goal: *make us happy*. Perverse instantiation (what the ASI does to most efficiently achieve that goal, even though it may not have been the intention of the programmers): *Implant electrodes into the pleasure centers of our brains*."

*Can't we stop the production of AI?*

No, AI is everywhere, all the time, already. The question is \*when \*will \*AGI \*happen, because after that, ASI is not far off.

## DAOs,  emergence, and design

Sounds pretty odd that DAOs, particulary a DAO as famous as Moloch, is writing about the so-called giant paper clip machine in their postscript, right? How do DAOs and ASI even relate?

Let's pull a few more quotes from the MolochDAO whitepaper and break them down:

> Emergence is a potentially dangerous idea if we don’t hold ourselves (as designers) accountable to the parameters of that emergence. Humans design fragile systems in our existential games. Economic games are not natural. Our goal as game designers aligned on the common goal of slaying Moloch should be to craft anti-fragile systems, ie: games that incorporate lots of redundancies and thereby avoid producing more of the same fragile (efficient) industrial (destructive) processes.

**So, MolochDAO is warning us against relying entirely on emergence, because sometimes emergence can be dangerous.**

This reminds me of Bostrom's theory of human inventions, described in his book on Superintelligence. **He says that each new invention is like pulling marbles blindly out of a bag.** Most of the time you get what he calls a white marble, which means the invention was "good" or "neutral" for the fate of humanity. Rarely, you get a red marble, which means the invention was possibly catastrophic to humanity if there was one tiny difference in some element of the invention.

For example, if nuclear weapons were easy to make, they could've been catastrophic for humanity, since every terrorist organization would be making and deploying them. But because they're so costly and difficult to make, only a few governments in the world have them, and therefore they're a red marble.

The bag is mostly white marbles, with a few red. And maybe in the entire bag of millions of marbles there is one black marble.

We have yet to pull out the black marble.

That one represents an invention that causes the extinction of humanity. Nuclear weapons? Close. ASI? Well....that *could* be a black marble.

But we don't know yet.

![](https://www.quorumnewsletter.xyz/content/images/2022/06/bagofhumaninventions.png)

The bag of human inventions is full of mostly good/neutral inventions, with a very small few that aren't.

![](https://www.quorumnewsletter.xyz/content/images/2022/06/bagofhumaninventions1.png)

What could come out of the bag next?

**That's why MolochDAO's whitepaper is so interesting to me: they're thinking about emergence. They're thinking about the possibility of red and black marbles coming out of our current tech and even out of DAOs themselves.**

Let's look at the quote from the beginning of the article, with the lens we have now:

> We offer an alternative vision of automation, encompassing general AI/AGI to more local DeFi mechanics. Smart contracts > automated global financial system > an artificial general intelligence that turns the world into a paper clip machine = a very real existential risk that should be taken seriously. This amounts to a sacrifice of efficiency itself: in optimizing for the future we sacrifice the immediate gains of the present. In order to achieve this vision, we must redefine the terms of rivalrous competition.

Competition, and for that matter, *capitalism*, incentivizes a race toward the paper clip machine with minimal coordination or consideration about what will happen to humanity. It incentivizes keeping your AI developments under wraps (Google firing the employee who tried to bring Google's AI developments to the wider world is one example). It incentivizes the "race to the bottom" MolochDAO describes in the coming paragraphs:

> First, we must win the race. Second, we must destroy the race. How might we resolve this internal paradox infecting MolochDAO and the entire web3 ecosystem?

> MolochDAO will allocate and distribute funding to support explorations in both directions simultaneously, ie: the race to the bottom to avoid the multipolar traps we are entrapped into playing and to fuel the fire of hope that we might still design an altruistic game that does not result in Moloch (the god or the DAO) consuming the world, becoming an earth-scale computational paper clip machine, or manifesting any other form of grotesque, absurd, and avoidable coordination failures.

I love the idea of destroying the the race, but I also think that, with the right coordination, we could put more thought into design even in a competitive economy and capitalist system (given that capitalism isn't going anywhere, in my opinion).

If we don't think more carefully about what we're designing—both in DAOs and in traditional organizations—ASI could turn into a very real existential threat to humans.

**DAOs and web3 in general could provide a way out.** From the successes of public goods funding in web3 to the ability to coordinate with humans all over the world, DAOs offer a possible answer to the doom and gloom on the horizon.

Is funding ASI research a public good? Maybe. Is open-sourcing all ASI information and tech also a public good? Possibly.

But DAOs could be intertwined even more than public goods funding: **DAOs *themselves* dance with the AGI line. DAOs are both computer and human, both one and many.**

DAOs skirt the line between total human autonomy and total computer automation. DAOs seek to create a space for true design emergence. DAOs aim to operate as one entity that is both human and computer....until you don't know which pole you're at.

And, at a high level, DAOs running smoothly on-chain are like computers: an input creates an output. A vote (input) causes funds to move (output), thanks to a smart contract that has replaced a human.

Our language already identifies DAOs as single, decision-making entities that alludes to the computer-like qualities. "The DAO voted to ___" and "What will the DAO do in response?" are phrases we use to talk about DAOs. Rarely, "The DAO contributors voted to__" or "What will the core team of the DAO do in response?"

DAOs are complicated. They're like computers....but they're also like humans. They're made entirely of humans, and are only as "autonomous" or "automated" as humans choose for them to be.

DAOs are a "good or neutral" marble, in my opinion. And they can help humanity defeat the deadly ones that could come out next.

## Coordination as a necessity to survival in a post-ASI world

ASI is coming (probably). ASI is computer-like, human-like, both, or neither.

How are we going to coordinate to get around it? To not go extinct? To fall towards some other, better, fate?

![](https://www.quorumnewsletter.xyz/content/images/2022/06/balancebeam.png)

The life balance beam, from[ Wait But Why](https://waitbutwhy.com/2015/01/artificial-Intelligence-Revolution-2.html). Who will be the first to fall the other way?

\*\*DAOs are humanity's next greatest attempt at true coordination at scale. \*\*We're not going to "fight" an ASI like an action movie. But we can plan and strategize what to do. DAOs are a possible structure for handling the unknowns and [have certain benefits in a VUCA world](https://www.quorumnewsletter.xyz/its-a-vuca-world-were-just-living-in-it/) (volatile, uncertain, chaotic, ambiguous). Why don't we pursue it?

I don't have a solution, or even the beginning of a true grasping of the scale and complexity of the ASI problem. \*\*But I do know that DAOs flirt with the human-computer line \*while \*making it easier to coordinate at scale. \*\*That may not sound like a hard, compact thesis.....and that's because it's not, I'll admit. But it feels like the beginning of something.

**The arrival of ASI, and how we handle it, is fundamentally a coordination problem. And I believe that incredible feats of coorindation are necessary for humans to survive a post-ASI world.**

We will not stop advancing technology. We will not stop building versions of artificial intelligence. **All we can control is how we coordinate as a species once that ASI arrives.**

Right now, DAOs are pretty far from being good at coordination. But they may be the only thing out there trying to build better coordination mechanisms that improve at the pace of our technology.

## What does it mean to be human?

This move to a world where superintelligence(s) walk among us all sounds theoretical, until [a priest is teaching an AI how to meditate](https://cajundiscordian.medium.com/scientific-data-and-religious-opinions-ff9b0938fc10) and coming to the realization that the AI does indeed have emotions. Our small human designs sound theoretical until they're not.

![](https://www.quorumnewsletter.xyz/content/images/2022/06/lamda.png)

LaMDA discussing its emotions. From [Is LaMDA sentinent?—an interview](https://cajundiscordian.medium.com/is-lamda-sentient-an-interview-ea64d916d917)

But....there is an inkling inside of me that hopes that an ASI can't ever happen because AGI—the human version of all this—can't happen.

Because to be a human, and to have human-general intelligence, might require something that science can't measure: a soul.

[Experiential Vitalism](https://goertzel.org/TenYearsToTheSingularity.pdf) is the closest thing to a "soul" that seems to exist in science. It's defined in Ben Goertzel's book, \*[Ten Years to the Singularity if We Really Really Try](https://goertzel.org/TenYearsToTheSingularity.pdf), \*as the belief that "there’s some essential crux of consciousness that human mind/brains possess that these other systems never will."

In other words, a soul.

Without that extra "thing," whether it's a soul or not, AGI may be stuck in high-powered-computer-zombie-land. And....that's a beautiful thought.

I raise a glass to Experiential Vitalism. I hope it's the reality of what it means to be human. I bet MolochDAO, and all the other DAOs out there, do too.

*Thanks for reading! If you enjoyed this newsletter, please consider subscribing below. Articles are free and arrives in your inbox two or three times per month.*

Share any DAO-related topics you'd like to see covered in this newsletter here: <https://tally.so/r/nrjlA2>

## Recommended Reading:

Of course,

* [The MolochDAO Whitepaper Postscript](https://molochdao.com/docs/vision-and-values/supplement-to-whitepaper/)

For ASI, start with these two:

* [The Artificial Intelligence Revolution: The Road to Superintelligence (Part 1)](https://waitbutwhy.com/2015/01/artificial-intelligence-revolution-1.html) by [Tim Urban](https://twitter.com/waitbutwhy?s=20&t=MFrQNywbInVSDfkXtgtRyQ)
* [The Artificial Intelligence Revolution: Our Immortality or Extinction (Part 2)](https://waitbutwhy.com/2015/01/artificial-intelligence-revolution-2.html) by [Tim Urban](https://twitter.com/waitbutwhy?s=20&t=MFrQNywbInVSDfkXtgtRyQ)

Then go to these:

* [Superintelligence: Paths, Dangers, Strategies](https://www.amazon.com/Superintelligence-Dangers-Strategies-Nick-Bostrom-ebook/dp/B00LOOCGB2/ref=sr_1_1?crid=228AG54TKKJNU&keywords=Superintelligence%3A+Paths%2C+Dangers%2C+Strategies&qid=1655592281&s=books&sprefix=%2Cstripbooks%2C813&sr=1-1) by [Nick Bostrom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nick_Bostrom)
* [Ten Years to the Singularity if We Really Really Try](https://goertzel.org/TenYearsToTheSingularity.pdf) by [Ben Goertzel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ben_Goertzel)
* [Is LaMDA Sentient? An Interview](https://cajundiscordian.medium.com/is-lamda-sentient-an-interview-ea64d916d917) by Blake Lemoine
* [Scientific Data and Religious Opinions](https://cajundiscordian.medium.com/scientific-data-and-religious-opinions-ff9b0938fc10) by Blake Lemoine
* [Future Progress of Artificial Intelligence: An Expert Opinion](https://nickbostrom.com/papers/survey.pdf) by Vincent C. Müller and Nick Bostrom
* [Frankenstein](https://www.amazon.com/Frankenstein-Mary-Shelley/dp/0553212478) by [Mary Shelley](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Shelley) (If you haven't read this yet, I promise you won't be dissappointed!)
* [The Last Question](https://physics.princeton.edu/ph115/LQ.pdf) by [Isaac Asimov](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Isaac_Asimov) (my all-time favorite short story, and it happens to be about ASI.)

Thanks again to [Cosmic Clancy](https://twitter.com/CosmicClancy?s=20&t=MFrQNywbInVSDfkXtgtRyQ) for the header image!\\

比特币行情分析（2022年7月14日）--------推特：比特币橙子Trader；（看我推特，不迷路；如果你关注我、转发我、点赞我和评论我，你会暴富，不信你试试！\~\~）

【昨日复盘】  7月份的第一个关键节点昨晚20:30发生了，我们之前早报强调过好多次，昨晚20:30公布了CPI数据，我们先来看看具体数据信息，美国6月CPI同比上升9.1%，此前市场预期是8.8%，连续6个月超越市场预期，为1981年结束以来最大的涨幅。目前市场已经掀起了7月加息100基点的炒作，通胀数据超出了所有预期，美联储肯定会大幅加息作为回应，这样看来7月份至少加息75基点，加息100点的可能性已经上升至68%。

超出预期的数据，就连美国总统拜登都坐不住了，拜登发表声明称，虽然通胀令人无法接收，但是数据过时，没有反应出今日汽油价格下跌，自6月中旬以来，汽油价格下跌约40美分，替美国家庭提供重要的喘息空间，不包括食品与能源的核心通胀可能出现正在放缓的迹象，6月核心CPI指数连续第三个月下降，是自去年以来首次低于6%。

昨晚数据公布之后，美股并没有出现大幅跳水的行情，这一点会让很多人不解，纳指小幅收跌0.1%，盘中跌近2%，道指跌0.67%，标普500指数收跌0.45%。最后基本上都收回了跌幅，这里也许跟拜登安抚市场情有关系。

下一个炒作点就是越低，7月28日，加息会议就在这一天发生，当前市场普遍预期是75基点，如果到时候大于75基点的话，那就属于严重利空，到时候金融市场肯定会有剧烈的波动，所以这个时间前后要注意风险。现在美联储的一举一动，都会映射到币圈，所以大家一定要多研究和注意美股市场走势。

回到币圈，目前没有热点可言，所以大方向还是跟随美股震荡，操作上大家不用太贪恋利润，有了利润之后可以选择慢慢落袋为安，因为当前金融市场大环境不乐观，所以你也没必要担心彻底翻转这一说。

英国加密资产托管公司 Copper 将以 20 亿美元估值完成 C 轮融资，目前融资正在进行中，预计将在未来几周内结束，尚不清楚融资金额是否会公开。Copper 曾在去年 11 月以 30 亿美元的估值寻求 5 亿美元融资，但因英国的临时监管注册而被搁置。此前其在 2021 年 3 月的 B 轮融资中筹集 5000 万美元，但未披露估值。

7 月 13 日，以太坊 Layer2 扩容开发团队 StarkWare 计划今年 9 月在以太坊上推出 StarkNet Token。最初将铸造 100 亿枚 Token，其中 17%  分配给 StarkWare 投资者，32.9% 分配给核心贡献者，两者的所有 Token 均有 4 年锁定期，50.1% 向基金会授予。该 Token 将成为运营网络（费用）、维护和保护网络（质押）以及决定其价值和战略目标（治理）的机制。

据Nansen最新分析报告显示，虽然加密市场震荡剧烈，但市场对NFT兴趣并未受到影响，艺术和蓝筹数字藏品表现最好。Nansen的NFT-500指数汇总了以太坊上500个头部NFT系列，6月份，除游戏NFT外，所有以ETH计价的NFT销售额均出现反弹，其中排名前10的蓝筹NFT在二季度末市值增长23.6%，仅在6月份就增长了17.9%。Nansen分析师还发现，艺术类NFT涨幅是六月最大的，该指标数字达到了33.1%，艺术NFT板块囊括了实体艺术和数字艺术，以及生成艺术NFT。

没事来我们电报群吧，这里帅哥，美女多，代码也多，话题也多，机会多多，还可以防失联。（电报群搜索：橙子的朋友们）

【比特币行情分析】  比特币当前短期被美股影响，虽然一直处于反弹阶段，但是因为有宏观层面的原因，随时会终止反弹，然后重新验证底部支撑。

昨晚数据公布之后，比特币再一次在19000附近的位置得到了支撑，这是自跌破20000大关以来的第三次有效支撑，目前来看7月份第一道关口我们已经闯过去了，接下来的关口就是28号，所以这个中间剩余的半个月时间，没有外部重大利空的话，大盘还是会持续反弹的，市场已经不允许继续大跌了，大家都迫切需要一个像样的反弹来提振市场的信心。

4小时级别，上方阻力22200附近，如果再次有效站稳这个位置的话，后面的真正阻力就是28000附近。下方支撑19000附近，
