title: DeHeroGame will start the TT (Technical Test) on July 14
body:
DeHeroGame will be run  TT (Technical Test) on the RangersProtocol mainnet from July 14th to July 28th.

Before you experience the new gameplay, please take a few minutes to get an overview of what this TT is about:

**About DeHeroGame TT content**

1\. The Technical Test will start at 16:00 on July 14th, 2022 (UTC+8); Test address: <https://rp.dehero.co/>

2\. This test will use the UNIPASS account system, please click here to [view the UNIPASS related introduction](https://mixmarvel.gitbook.io/dehero_game/v/en/)

3\. This Technical Test is a Wipe test. All related assets in the account will be wiped after the test, but the account will be retained. You can use this account to participate in the next test.

4、Players can receive the gift package via the address>><https://airdrop.dehero.co/>

![Gift Package](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dsphhzVOmACp2s7Yf2Czt.png?height=586&width=784)

**Technical Test  content**

1\.Access to Unipass's account system to fully open up the access channel for web2.0 users;

2\.Hero level cap opened to level 90;

3\.The PVE adventure opens to chapter 9;

4\.Added multiple quick battle functions;

5\.Added batch payment to open treasure chest function;

6\.Added shortcut operations such as batch removal skills;

7\.According to user feedback, some problems have been fixed and optimized.

**Technical Test  Event**

During the test period, upgrade cards to meet the following conditions, you can get airdrop rewards when the main network is officially launched.

Event time: July 14th - July 28th

Activity content: During the test period, have 5 or more cards and reach the following levels:

5 or more cards with level 30 - blue game card pack\**1*

5 or more cards with level 40 - purple game card pack\*1

5 or more cards with level 60 - orange game card pack\*1

Tips: Event rewards will be distributed uniformly when the mainnet is officially launched.

**BUG/Suggest submission**

During the test, you may encounter various game bugs or deficiencies. We hope that users can actively participate and put forward your questions and ideas to help us better improve DeHeroGame!

submission address: <https://forms.gle/8XVMBRUcjLApWXLy9>

**About DeHeroGame**

DeHeroGame is a blockchain game published by MixMarvel with a global heroic fight as the background, and it was first released on RangersProtocol. Rich hero development and combination of professions and skills, train different heroes from various parallel worlds. Reasonably allocate different heroes to challenge nearly a hundred dungeon levels of different difficulty, and start an adventure in a different world.

title: Lido对以太坊2.0的良性质押
body:
**1、目前看到比较普遍的误解是Lido如果质押的ETH超过51%，会产生中心化风险。**

关于这个Lido的顾问hasu在一次采访中给出了比较系统的解答，概括来说：

1\.1、Lido不是一个实体，而是一个中间层协议，或者简单理解为一个“联盟”，目前有29个节点运营商

1\.2、节点运营商是真实抵押ETH的实体，“类似”现在POW的矿池，Lido无法直接控制节点运营商

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zgNR8Wm0LfiApQ6KKa1aC.jpg?height=2160&width=3840)

在某些情况下，如果Lido对筛选运营商的价值观过于统一，会导致一些软性的治理风险，因此Lido的治理也引入了双重治理模型，stETH质押人拥有治理否决权

1\.3、如果没有Lido的存在，我们可以看下目前排在前列的质押人：kraken、coinbase、binance，如果交易所占据过多的抵押，相信不会是一件好事

通过这几个方面看，Lido对以太坊2.0的良性质押更有帮助

title: BK8Thai คาสิโนออนไลน์【โบนัสต้อนรับสมาชิกใหม่ 250%】
body:
# รีวิวเว็บพนันออนไลน์ BK8

หากคุณกำลังมองหาเว็บพนันออนไลน์ที่ตอบโจทย์ทั้งเรื่องความปลอดภัย อัตราผลตอบแทน และฟีเจอร์เกมที่ครบครันอยู่ละก็ BK8 คือหนึ่งในตัวเลือกที่ดีที่สุดที่คุณไม่ควรพลาด! เพราะนวัตกรรมทางเทคโนโลยีที่รุกหน้าอยู่ในทุกวินาที ผู้พัฒนาเกมจึงคิดค้นบริการใหม่ๆ ซึ่งได้นำมาให้บริการแล้วที่ BK8 แพลตฟอร์มที่ตอบโจทย์ผู้เล่นได้อย่างหลากหลายสไตล์ พร้อมอัปเดระบบ UX/UI ให้สมจริงอย่างต่อเนื่อง ผ่านการบริการที่เน้นความเป็นส่วนตัวและรวดเร็ว เพลิดเพลินไปกับบริการเกมระดับสากลที่ให้โบนัสและผลตอบแทนที่ดีที่สุด

## BK8 คืออะไร?

BK8 ให้บริการในฐานะบริษัทการพนันออนไลน์รายใหญ่รายหนึ่งในวงการ ที่เริ่มต้นเว็บขึ้นเมื่อปี 2015 ซึ่งนำเสนอตัวเลือกเกมจากค่ายซอฟต์แวร์ชั้นนำจำนวนมาก ทั้งกีฬา, คาสิโน, สล็อต, เกมอีสปอร์ต และอีกเพียบ ผ่านแพลตฟอร์มที่พัฒนาด้วยเทคโนโลยีใหม่ล่าสุดที่เพิ่มอรรถรสการลุ้นเกมได้อย่างสมจริงมากยิ่งขึ้นตอกย้ำความยิ่งใหญ่ของ BK8 ผู้ให้สนับสนุนป้ายโฆษณาดิจิตอลอย่างเป็นทางการของลีก สเปน 2018/19 และยังมีแบรนด์แอมบาสเดอร์เป็นนักฟุตบอลจากทีมชั้นนำอีกด้วย

โดยที่นี่จะเน้นการเล่นเกมอย่างปลอดภัยและเป็นส่วนตัว บนพื้นฐานของความรวดเร็วและการสร้างผลตอบแทนที่คุ้มค่า BK8 ได้รังสรรค์บริการแบบครบวงจรเพื่อประสบการณ์การเดิมพันที่ไร้รอยต่อ พร้อมทีมงานที่ให้คำแนะนำตลอด 24 ชั่วโมง สมาชิกสามารถลุ้นรับโบนัสได้แบบรายวัน พร้อมเข้าถึงบริการได้จากทุกที่ ทั้งมือถือ, คอมพิวเตอร์, แล็ปท็อป หรือแม้แต่จะเข้าผ่านแอปฯ BK8 ก็ได้เช่นเดียวกัน

## เกมใดบ้างที่เปิดให้เดิมพันที่ BK8

จากพันธมิตรค่ายเกมที่เข้าร่วมกับ BK8 จำนวนมาก ทำให้สมาชิกได้มีโอกาสเดิมพันในเกมที่พวกเขาชื่นชอบ และได้เปิดประสบการณ์ใหม่ๆ จากเกมที่อัปเดตใหม่ล่าสุด! เช็คลิสต์ 4 เกมยอดนิยมที่เปิดให้บริการบน BK8 ตามด้านล่างนี้

### 1. เกมกีฬา

เดิมพันกีฬากับ BK8 คุณจะพบกับแมทซ์เกมระดับโลกที่ไม่ควรพลาดอย่างยิ่ง! ทั้งการแข่งขันระดับชิงแชมป์, ลีกในและต่างประเทศ รวมถึงเกมการแข่งขันระดับโลก ได้รวมมาให้คุณได้เลือกเล่นที่นี้แล้ว

### 2. เกมอีสปอร์ต

เทคโนโลยีเกมแนวใหม่ล่าสุดที่ผสมผสานการแข่งขันเข้ากับเกมออนไลน์ไว้อย่างสมบูรณ์ ด้วยความนิยมในเกมอีสปอร์ต คุณสามารถเลือกเดิมพันในทีมที่คิดว่าจะชนะได้อย่างแน่นอน เพื่อลุ้นรับรางวัลโบนัสสุดยิ่งใหญ่

### 3.เกมคาสิโนสด

แนวเกมสุดคลาสิกที่ถูกนำมาให้บริการแบบเวอร์ชั่นคาสิโนสด เพิ่มดีกรีความตื่นเต้นและความสนุกตลอดทั้งเกม พร้อมมีดีลเลอร์ที่คอยให้บริการและคำแนะนำ เพื่อการเล่นเกมที่สอดคล้องกับการสร้างผลตอบแทนของคุณ

### 4. เกมสล็อต

รับเงินรางวัลแจ็คพอตจากเกมได้ไม่ยาก หากเข้าใจวิธีการเล่นสล็อตออนไลน์ที่ดีพอ เพราะเกมนี้ผู้เล่นสามารถคว้าเงินรางวัลได้ภายในไม่กี่นาที เป็นเกมที่มีทั้งโบนัสฟรีสปินและโชคใหญ่จากแจ็คพอตให้ลุ้นตลอดทั้งเกม

## ลุ้นรับรางวัลพิเศษกับลีดเดอร์บอร์ด

BK8 เข้าใจสไตล์การเดิมพันในยุคนี้เป็นอย่างดี จึงได้นำเสนอแคมเปญสุดพิเศษที่สมาชิกสามารถเพิ่มช่องทางการสร้างผลตอบแทนได้อีกทางหนึ่ง ผ่านรางวัลพิเศษกับลีดเดอร์บอร์ดที่ยิ่งอยู่ในอันดับสูง ของรางวัลก็ยิ่งมีมูลค่าที่สูงขึ้น

* คะแนนมีการอัปเดตแบบเรียลไทม์ โดยสมาชิกสามารถตรวจสอบได้ตลอดผ่านทางหน้าเว็บ
* การจัดอันดับจะมีการวัดผลแบบรายเดือน โดยสมาชิกท่านไหนมีอันดับที่ดีที่สุด 10 อันดับภายในเดือนนั้น ก็มี

โอกาสรับรางวัลพิเศษที่สูงขึ้นไปด้วย

* แคมเปญนี้รองรับการเล่นเกมที่หลากหลาย เช่น กีฬา, คาสิโนสดสล็อต, ตกปลา และลอตเตอรี่
* ระดับสมาชิกที่ BK8 จะเริ่มตั้งแต่ Normal, Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum, Diamond
* อันดับผู้เล่นและรางวัลจะจัดแยกไปตามแต่ละประเภทเกมและระดับสมาชิก

## ประสบการณ์เดิมพันระดับ VIP

อย่างที่รู้ว่าใครๆ ก็อยากอัปเกรดระดับสมาชิกให้มาเป็น VIP กันทั้งนั้น เพราะนอกจากจะมีโอกาสเคลมโบนัสได้หลากหลายยิ่งขึ้นแล้ว ยังมีสิทธิพิเศษอื่นๆ ที่จะได้รับตลอดทั้งเกมการเล่นอีกด้วย

* สมาชิกทั่วไปสามารถอัปเกรดระดับสมาชิกมาเป็น VIP ได้ เพียงฝากเงินตามขั้นต่ำที่กำหนดไว้
* จะใช้เวลาสูงสุด 2 วันทำการในการตรวจสอบและอัปเดตสถานะสมาชิก
* BK8 ได้กำหนดสิทธิพิเศษและของรางวัลที่เตรียมให้เฉพาะสมาชิก VIP เท่านั้น
* สมาชิก VIP มีโอกาสรับสิทธิพิเศษมากมาย เช่น เพิ่มยอดถอนสูงสุดต่อวัน, โบนัสตามเทศกาลต่างๆ, คืนเงินรางวัล และของขวัญอื่นๆ อีกเพียบ
* สมาชิก VIP ต้องมียอดสะสมตรงตามเกณฑ์ที่กำหนดเพื่อรักษาระดับสมาชิก

## จะเริ่มพนันที่ BK8 ได้อย่างไร?

ถ้าคุณอ่านมาถึงตรงนี้ คุณก็น่าจะพร้อมแล้วที่จะเริ่มสร้างผลตอบแทนจาก BK8 เว็บคาสิโนออนไลน์ที่ดีและน่าเชื่อถือที่สุด อ่านขั้นตอนและรายละเอียดที่สรุปมาให้ดังนี้เพื่อเริ่มสมัครสมาชิกและคว้าโบนัสได้ก่อนใคร

### ขั้นตอนที่ 1 ลงทะเบียนสมัครสมาชิก

อันดับแรกให้คุณสมัครสมาชิกเพื่อเปิดบัญชีเกมซะก่อน โดยเลือกได้ว่าจะสมัครผ่านทางหน้าเว็บไซต์, ผ่านแอปพลิเคชั่น BK8 หรือจะสมัครผ่านไลน์

### ขั้นตอนที่ 2 ฝากเงินและเคลมโบนัส

ทำการโอนเงินเข้าสู่ระบบเพื่อใช้ในการเล่นเกม โดยขั้นต่ำในการฝากจะอยู่ที่ 100 บาท อย่างไรก็ตามให้ตรวจสอบจำนวนเงินอีกทีระหว่างที่สมัคร หลังจากนั้นโบนัสสมาชิกใหม่จะถูกเคลมอัตโนมัติ แต่ถ้าคุณมีสิทธิ์ในโบนัสอื่นๆ อีก ก็สามารถเคลมรับเพิ่มได้เช่นกัน

### ขั้นตอนที่ 3 เริ่มเกมเดิมพัน

ในขั้นตอนนี้ คุณสามารถเลือกเกมที่ต้องการเล่นได้เลย ซึ่งกติกาและวิธีการเล่นจะถูกกำหนดไว้อีกทีหนึ่งตามแต่ละประเภทเกม

### ขั้นตอนที่ 4 ถอนเงินรางวัล

หากคุณได้รับชัยชนะและคว้าเงินรางวัลมาได้ ก็เข้าสู่ขั้นตอนการถอนเงินรางวัลจากบัญชีเกม ซึ่งการถอนได้รับการอนุมัติเมื่อผู้เล่นทำเงื่อนไขผ่านทุกข้อ โดยตัวเลือกที่ใช้ในการถอนจะอธิบายไว้ในส่วนถัดไป

## วิธีการชำระเงิน BK8

สำหรับทางเลือกในการทำธุรกรรมออนไลน์ที่ BK8 นั้นสมาชิกสามารถสบายใจได้เลย เพราะที่นี่ได้มีการนำเสนอวิธีการฝากถอนไว้หลากหลายวิธี ซึ่งแต่ละแบบก็เป็นที่คุ้นเคยของสมาชิกอยู่แล้ว ติดตามลิสต์ด้านล่างนี้เพื่อเลือกวิธีการชำระเงินที่ดีที่สุด

### การฝากเงิน

* โอนเงินผ่านธนาคาร – เป็นวิธีที่ผู้ใช้งานน่าจะคุ้นเคยกันมากที่สุด โดยหลังจากทำการโอนเงินเข้าบัญชีแล้ว ก็ให้ทำการอัพโหลดสลิปเพื่อรอการยืนยันจากระบบ
* Help2Pay/EeziePay – เป็นอีกหนึ่งแพลตฟอร์มที่ใช้งานง่ายและประหยัดเวลาแบบสุดๆ เพียงเลือการฝากด้วยวิธีนี้บน BK8 จากนั้นกรอดข้อมูล และยืนยันด้วยรหัสอนุมัติการทำธุรกรรม TAC ที่ธนาคารของคุณจะส่งมา
* QR Code - ทางเลือกใหม่ที่ไม่ต้องยืนยันอะไรทั้งนั้น เพียงแสกน QR Code บนหน้าเว็บการทำธุรกรรมออนไลน์ แล้วดำเนินการฝากเงิน เพียงเท่านี้ก็สามารถเริ่มเกมออนไลน์ได้ทันที
* E-wallet – ทุกวันนี้มี E-wallet ให้เลือกใช้เป็นจำนวนมาก โดยที่ BK8 คุณก็สามารถฝากเงินเข้าระบบได้แบบง่ายๆ เช่นกัน
* ฝากเงินผ่านคริปโทเคอร์เรนซี – ตอบโจทย์สายคริปโตเคอเรนซี่แบบสุดๆ สำหรับการฝากเงินด้วยสกุลเงินดิจิทัลที่รองรับทั้งบิทคอยน์, อีเธอเรียม และอื่นๆ

### การถอนเงิน

ในส่วนของการถอนเงินนั้น BK8 ได้นำเสนอตัวเลือกผ่านทางธนาคารในประเทศ ซึ่งเป็นวิธีการที่ปลอดภัยและส่วนใหญ่ใช้งานเป็น เพียงกรอกรายละเอียดเพื่อการยืนยัน เช่น ชื่อบัญชี, เลขที่บัญชี, ชื่อธนาคาร รวมถึงยื่นเอกสารที่จำเป็นในขั้นตอนแรกเพื่อความปลอดภัยในการใช้งาน

## ข้อดีและข้อเสียบน BK8

เพื่อสรุปภาพรวมของเว็บ BK8 กันอีกสักครั้งหนึ่ง เราได้จัดทำลิสต์ข้อดีและข้อเสียที่ผู้เล่นมักพบระหว่างการเล่น ซึ่งเป็นได้สูงมากที่คุณจะได้รับประสบการณ์แบบเดียวกันนี้เมื่อเริ่มเกมบน BK8 จะมีอะไรบ้างไปดูกัน

### ข้อดี

#### เกมหลากหลายครบครันทุกมิติ:

มีการนำเสนอเกมที่ครอบคลุมตั้งแต่สล็อตออนไลน์, คาสิโนสด, เกมอีสปอร์ต ไปจนถึงเกมพนันกีฬา

#### เน้นความปลอดภัยและความเป็นส่วนตัว:

พัฒนาเทคโนโลยีที่ช่วยสร้างความมั่นใจระหว่างการเล่นเกม พร้อมมีใบรับรองในการให้บริการของ BK8

#### รองรับการเล่นผ่านมือถือ:

BK8 ได้พัฒนาการเล่นผ่านแอปพลิเคชั่นที่ตอบโจทย์เรื่องความรวดเร็วและความปลอดภัยในการเล่น นอกจากนี้ยังสามารถเข้าใช้งานได้โดยตรงผ่านทางเว็บบราวเซอร์ได้อีกด้วย

#### เคลมรับโบนัสได้ทุกวัน:

BK8 มีการเสนอโบนัสแจกใหม่ในทุกๆ วัน ซึ่งมีส่วนช่วยให้รูปแบบการเล่นของคุณมีประสิทธิภาพมากขึ้น

### ข้อจำกัด

#### มีขั้นต่ำในการเล่นเกม:

ทางเว็บมีการกำหนดขั้นต่ำในการฝากเงินเข้าสู่ระบบเพื่อเล่นเกม ซึ่งแม้จะเป็นจำนวนเงินที่ไม่มากแต่อาจสร้างอุปสรรคให้แก่ผู้เล่นได้ไม่น้อย

#### มีการกำหนดยอดเงินเดิมพันหมุนเวียน:

แม้ทางเว็บจะนำเสนอโบนัสจำนวนมากให้แก่สมาชิกแต่นั้นก็มาพร้อมเงื่อนไขที่เป็นอุปสรรคของผู้เล่น เช่น ยอดเงินเดิมพันหมุนเวียน, ยอดเทิร์นโอเวอร์ เป็นต้น

## สรุปรีวิว BK8

โดยภาพรวมแล้ว BK8 นับเป็นแบรนด์คาสิโนออนไลน์ที่แข็งแกร่งและได้รับความนิยมมาเป็นอันดับต้นๆ ซึ่งสามารถครองใจเหล่าสาวกเกมออนไลน์และสมาชิกรายใหม่อย่างต่อเนื่อง โดยเฉพาะกลุ่มผู้เล่นที่ต้องการความครอบคลุมของบริการไม่ว่าจะเป็นการฝากถอนออนไลน์, การเล่นผ่านมือถือ, การนำเสนอบทวิเคราะห์เกม, การเปิดให้เคลมโบนัส รวมถึงความครบครันของประเภทเกมที่มีตั้งแต่สล็อตออนไลน์ไปจนถึงเกมพนันกีฬา ดังนั้นจึงปฏิเสธไม่ได้จริงๆ ว่า BK8 คือหนึ่งในเว็บคาสิโนที่ตอบโจทย์สไตล์ผู้เล่นในยุคนี้มากๆ ซึ่งจะเน้นไปที่ความเป็นส่วนตัวและฟีเจอร์เกมแบบจัดเต็ม

title: 最具人生哲理的一句话，现实犀利，受用一生！
body:
一、人生是很累的，你现在不累，以后就会更累。人生是很苦的，你现在不苦，以后就会更苦。唯累过，方得闲。唯苦过，方知甜。

二、世人贪婪，总想寻找两全，但这世间难有什么两全之策。人生百年，不过是教人如何取舍。

三、没必要让所有人知道真实的你，或者是你没有必要不停地向人说其实我是一个什么样的人。因为这是无效的，人们还是只会愿意看到他们希望看到的。

四、不惊扰别人的宁静，就是慈悲；不伤害别人的自尊，就是善良。人活着，发自己的光就好，不要吹灭别人的灯。

五、你是为自己而活，怎么会因为别人的几句流言蜚语就改变，难道别人说你长得丑你就不要这张脸了吗？那你也太没性格了。

六、不要因为一点小事就烦躁不堪，不要碰到一点困难就一蹶不振，不要一次失恋就否定一切，想要走出黑暗，只有自己站起来，因为没有人能帮你，只有你自己能救自己。

七、钱没了可以再挣，朋友没了可以再交，爱情没了可以再找，记住，你什么都不缺，你缺的是一份重新开始的勇气。

八、因为别人的评价，我们磨掉了多少棱角，丢掉了多少独一无二的性格；在乎的时间愈久，我们就会分不清生命究竟是活给自己看，还是活给别人看。

九、就算人生是出悲剧，我们要有声有色地演这出悲剧，不要失掉了悲剧的壮丽和快慰；就算人生是个梦，我们也要有滋有味地做这个梦，不要失掉了梦的情致和乐趣。

十、时间把一些人带来，又让他们以各种方式离开，大概就是为了以疼痛教会我们看开、习惯、释怀。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JbMdGuY-FDZhDR9iX8FvM.jpeg?height=799&width=640)

十一、别自制压力，我们没有必要跟着时间走，只需跟着心态和能力走，随缘，尽力，达命，问心无愧，其他的，交给天。

十二、如果有一天，让你心动的再也感动不了你，让你愤怒的再也激怒不了你，让你悲伤的再也不能让你流泪，你便知道这时光，这生活给了你什么，你为了成长，付出了什么。

十三、成年人的世界除了快乐是假的，钱难赚是真的，心难交是真的，无助是真的，迷茫是真的，回头一看没有人依靠也是真的。

十四、人生就像饺子，岁月是皮，经历是馅。生活太现实，一切是这样的顺其自然，一辈子，就图个心里痛快。那些想不通头疼，想通了心疼的人事，不如淡然视之。

十五、别人都在你看不到的地方暗自努力，在你看得到的地方，他们也和你一样显得吊儿郎当，和你一样会抱怨，而只有你自己相信这些都是真的，最后也只有你一人继续不思进取。

十六、一个人的自愈的能力越强，就越有可能接近幸福。做一个寡言，却心有一片海的人，不伤人害己，于淡泊中，平和自在。

十七、人的烦恼就12个字：放不下，想不开，看不透，忘不了。带着简单的心情，看复杂的人生，走坎坷的路。人生，简单就快乐，生活，开心就好！

十八、人们总以为生活稀松平常，总在把挥霍当成常态。其实生命极其有限，每一个不曾努力的日子，都是对自己的一种辜负。最大的浪费，莫过于挥掷时光；最大的珍惜，莫过于时不虚度。

十九、凡事不必苛求，来了就来了；凡事不必计较，过了就过了；遇事不要皱眉，笑了就笑了；结果不要强求，做了就对了。

二十、只有把你自己的生活过到足够好时，你才有闲心和资格去评论他人的生活，而当你过得真的足够好时，你可能更没有闲心去评论了，因为你只热爱你自己所拥有的生活。

二一、人生没有那么多的公平可言。偏转一下你的航向，逆风就会成为顺风。刻苦努力，坚持不懈，最终耀眼的太阳就会跑到你的身后。你生活的起点并不是那么重要，重要的是最后你抵达了哪里。

CropBytes 团队于 2021年11月 完成了他们的 260 万融资，融资方包括全球知名风投和行业领袖 Draper Dragon、Old Fashion Research、Exnetwork Capital、Kryptos Research、AVStar Capital、AU21 Capital、Master Ventures、EPNS、Strip Finance 等。此外，还有天使投资人和顾问，如 WazirX 的首席运营官 Siddharth Menon、Polygon 的首席运营官 Sandeep Nailwal、ExNetwork Capital 的创始人 Eric Su、EPNS 的创始人 Harsh Rajat、Solana 的增长负责人Tamar Menteshashvili。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/45UibVIjKj32pMc3eCzkH.png?height=744&width=1080)

### Plato Farm（已上线）

🪙Token名称｜$MARK、$GMARK、$PLATO

🔗支持的区块链｜BSC

🖥支持的客户端｜网页端

Plato Farm官网：https://www.platofarm.game/

Plato Farm推特：https://mobile.twitter.com/plato_farm

Discord官方社区：https://discord.com/invite/ZXkeQBZVTS

Telegram官方社区：https://t.me/platofarm

**Plato Farm** 是一款以农场为主题的元宇宙生态项目，生态模型复刻了早期风靡一时的《QQ 农场》游戏，并且在整体的农场机制上更加复杂。Plato Farm 生态本身包含了种植和养殖这两种基础生产经济模型，以此为基础还包含了一个加工厂经济，加工厂除了能够加工畜牧养殖所需的必需品如饲料外，还能够加工果酱、面包等原材料加工成品，整体构成了一个供需关系较强的经济模型，PLATO 本身也是生态内的治理通证，持有该通证将能够参与生态内的投票，并且也能够享有权益。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xjYM2PGQkmICCQDnZ16pA.png?height=359&width=1080)

**团队信息**

Plato Farm 项目由 Second Space Studio 开发并于 2018 年上线，项目核心成员开发运营过种类繁多的大型网络游戏，来自侏罗纪世界进化等世界知名游戏团队和区块链开发商。Plato Farm 在北美市场取得了巨大成功，吸引了 200 万用户和超过 20 万的 DAU。该游戏将区块链的底层合约技术架构与完全嵌入的游戏内用户相结合，这些用户可以在其科学交易系统中通过边玩边赚钱来茁壮成长。

**投资机构**

Plato Farm迄今已经获得来自多家全球知名风投机构的投资，包括 Chronos Ventures, BlockVenture, Huobi Ventures, Formless, OKEx Blockdream Ventures, OP Crypto, Web4 Ventures, Cipholio Ventures, ZBS Capital, Chain Broker, CryptoDep, Vadym Piholenko, Gagarin Crypto, Gcrypto Media, Top 7 ICO, Block Patch, Incrypted, Bitwired, Magic Enterprises, CryptoPhd, Crypto Daku, Bitwired, Ethos vertical, Block Talks 等。

合作的钱包有 Huobi wallet, Coin98 wallet, BitKeep wallet, OnTo wallet and Coinhub wallet, TokenSoft, OKC, Safepal 等。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/sBpAy3-51v45AQRKhLq8e.png?height=1023&width=1080)

### 总结

🎮**一种经营性游戏向玩家经营，通过模拟不断的向玩家展示“欣欣向荣”的体验，让所的主体大发展，最后形成了**这种生长感。在实现目标的实现上，是玩家的目标。通过行动实现目标的智能形成策略来实现目标的成长，最终实现成就感的过程中壮大。

回到链上这方面，**游戏虽然有操作这块屏幕很容易，但似乎可以经营也只是模拟**，但链游的优点很少，链上的优点很少。相比于其他游PVE，链上几乎不存在任何类似PVE的游链，几乎没有任何冒险链，几乎没有任何冒险的人获得了更多的奖励，可能成为了庞氏经济。完全是个单机游戏。

title: Blockchains for Normies
body:
### DESCRIPTION

A first-step guide to raise your knowledge about blockchains’ architecture. This article is a selection of various materials, including articles and videos, arranged in the chronological order to achieve the highest level of effectiveness in step-by-step learning.

I have to clarify – that’s NOT a guide for total beginners in crypto. All content mentioned in the article is for those who are aware of the basic terminology & crypto market in general. FYI, the guide is based on my personal experience.

### CONTENTS

**DESCRIPTION
PART 1 - INTRODUCTION
PART 2 - BLOCKCHAINS
2\.1 - Ethereum
2\.2 - Cosmos
2\.3 - Rollups
2\.4 - Solana
2\.5 - Near
PART 3 - CONCLUSION**

> Hey, thanks for checking out! If you don’t like author to be talkative, just skip the introduction and jump directly to **PART 2**.

## PART 1 - INTRODUCTION

Lately, I’ve heard a lot of similar opinions like “That’s the best time to prepare yourself for the next bull market” or “Get out of charts and do some education instead”. If you actively participated in all the “degen” plays with tokens and NFTs, or were busy as a day-trader for a while, I’d presume there wasn’t enough time for such a silly thing as an **Education**. But isn’t that finally a perfect time as people keep telling us? What if we shift our focus to learn something fundamental? Of course, It’s always nice to earn money by investing or speculating on one or another asset. Especially, when we saw such a great performance of most of the projects and especially blockchains in 2021.

![ATOM/USD - Screenshot from Dropstab.com](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8eJdnSpY41ZFz7qR1dRUx.png?height=1189&width=1813)

![SOL/USD - Screenshot from Dropstab.com](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zftEaJUKtu7syUpofERTE.png?height=1190&width=1820)

And I’m sure many of you got extremely good profits along with that rise. But here are few questions “**Were you aware that LUNA’s death loop is inevitable? Did you try to buy this dip?”.** I have a feeling there are some, at least, who were not and tried so (*either was I*). Let’s not make the same mistakes again. Without further more (*I know you may get tired of a long introduction*) let’s jump into what I prepared for you.

## PART 2 - BLOCKCHAINS

So, education, huh? What can we start with? I’ve been thinking and perceived to start with just fundamental things – **Blockchains** and **Ecosystems**. If you’re interested in boosting your knowledge about blockchains and crypto in general, below you’ll find a selection of the related articles/videos. I found them extremely useful and perfectly fit for non-tech guys or “normies”.

> I have to clarify that the author is aware about whitepapers and other official resources, and that it is the best way to get familiar with functionality of blockchains and crypto protocols. But since the topic of this article is “**Blockchains for Normies**”, I prepared a selection of easy to understand materials to form a basic knowledge of structure and understanding of various tech aspects.

### 2.1 - ΞTHEREUM

We will start with the leading blockchain, the father of Smart contracts, DeFi and NFT – **ETHEREUM**. Some of you could react as “WHAT?! Where the heck is Bitcoin??”. I’m not a big fan of Bitcoin, to be honest, and, since the concept of both blockchains is pretty similar (*in relation to **proof-of-work** mechanism; please don’t kill me, I know there is a big difference called **EVM** - **Ethereum Virtual Machine***), I decided to start with that. The amazing article translated into various languages: 
 [How does Ethereum work, anyway?](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-ethereum-work-anyway). 
 (*I recommend to read it in English since improving English skills is our next big goal – more about that later*).

> If you really decided to dive into all of these things, follow the chronology, since I organized that for better understanding of the whole blockchain theory. Terms met in the first articles can be mentioned in the following ones.

Also, it’s quite compatible to watch this video in parallel with the first article:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOVAbKKSH10&t=5500s](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOVAbKKSH10&t=5500s)

(*Especially if you’re not familiar at all with **Decentralized finances**, **DApps** & **Smart contracts***).

### 2.2 - COSMOS

Okay, we’ve learnt some basic things about how the amazing technology of blockchain actually works. But you may ask “What about **proof-of-stake** concept? I heard many blockchains are based on it as on more energy efficient & more scalable analogue” (*or just “What’s next?”*). Not a big deal – the whole **validation & delegation** idea is greatly described in the next article about COSMOS ecosystem (*in 2 parts*):
[How does Cosmos work? How does it compare to Bitcoin and Ethereum? (Part 1)](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-cosmos-work-how-does-it-compare-to-bitcoin-and-ethereum-part-1)
[How does Cosmos work? How does it compare to Bitcoin and Ethereum? (Part 2)](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-cosmos-work-how-does-it-compare-to-bitcoin-and-ethereum-part-2)

”Damn, man, you’re just sending the articles of one particular author… You could send us her link and finish it” – IT’S NOT MY FAULT that her articles are such great for normies. But don’t judge me so fast, here will be more stuff.

### 2.3 - ROLLUPS

As long as we’re aware about the difference between **proof-of-stake** and **proof-of-work** mechanisms, let’s talk about another hot topic – **ZK ROLLUPS**. That’s almost impossible you haven’t seen at least some videos or threads about how promising rollups are, determining it as a next huge trend. I guess, that’s worthy not to put it away: [A normie's guide to rollups](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/a-normies-guide-to-rollups).
And the answer for “Which one is the best finally in that infinite battle?” can be found [here](https://medium.com/offchainlabs/optimistic-rollups-the-present-and-future-of-ethereum-scaling-60fb9067ae87) and [here](https://blog.polygon.technology/zk-and-the-future-of-ethereum-scaling/).

**Spoiler:**
.
.
.
Nobody knows exactly.

### 2.4 - S◎LANA

Next is **SOLANA**. The killer of Ethe… Okay, stop it. Nobody kills nobody. I guess we’ve settled that long time ago, heh. We can start with this article giving us an idea of how the Solana’s **proof-of-history** concept works:
[What Is Solana (SOL)? Learn About Ethereum’s Growing Rival](https://blockworks.co/what-is-solana-everything-you-need-to-know-about-the-ethereum-rival/).

Then check out this video:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rywOYfGu4EA&list=PLilwLeBwGuK6OFXWqyZ88E_ha21Oyr_Rf&index=2](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rywOYfGu4EA&list=PLilwLeBwGuK6OFXWqyZ88E_ha21Oyr_Rf&index=2)

And read the explanation by Solana’s founder Anatoly Yakovenko:
[Proof of History: A Clock for Blockchain](https://medium.com/solana-labs/proof-of-history-a-clock-for-blockchain-cf47a61a9274).

Seems more or less clear? I have to admit there are a lot of concerns and humors regarding Solana’s eligibility and transparency, especially regarding the concept of **proof-of-history**. But let’s leave it for scientists and mathematicians like [Victor Shoup](https://www.shoup.net/papers/poh.pdf) (*You may* *have a look at it, but be careful, it can hurt your brain if you’re not a sort of such guys*).

### 2.5 - NEAR

Let’s dive a little deeper and remind ourselves about **Ethereum 2.0**, its **proof-of-stake** mechanism and, what is the most important, learn about **sharding** technology (*we need it for better understanding of the functionality of our next candidate*). I have to warn you, this part is gonna be more complex comparing to the previous ones:
[Detailed overview of Ethereum 2.0 shard chains: Committees, Proposers and Attesters](https://medium.com/nearprotocol/detailed-overview-of-ethereum-2-0-shard-chains-committees-proposers-and-attesters-a9992d2fd103). (*Well, at least I felt this way*).

> Please note that TxFlow is not relevant at the moment. It’s still under development and testing, so you can skip it for now.

Great! I’m feeling how these articles are becoming easier and easier to deal with (*or not, because you just keep scrolling?!*).

![Author when you don't read the article carefully](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ufWQTbVfyKHwNPAGqPXyM.png?height=900&width=1333)

To be honest, I spent several days trying to find similar easy to read material about the **NEAR** Protocol, but either it was huge, either quite complicated. Finally here it is, right after I spent the whole day reading an official doc (*super lucky?*). But first, if you’re not familiar with the Near protocol at all, briefly check this introduction from the official team: [The Beginner’s Guide to the NEAR Blockchain](https://near.org/blog/the-beginners-guide-to-the-near-blockchain/).

For the rests – overview of the **Near** protocol: [NEAR Protocol ($NEAR)](https://thealpharchives.com/near-protocol-near).

If you haven’t gone through all the links attached to this great article above (*bet 99% you haven’t*), some parts might seem not so clear. Don’t worry, there’re just 2 important links you need to open. But there is a tiny detail… One of these links is exactly the one I’ve called “huge” earlier. If you’re that crazy person – try your passion and patience by reading these:
[Nightshades](https://near.org/downloads/Nightshade.pdf) (*just to clarify – 37 pages, good luck*);
[Doomslug](https://near.org/blog/doomslug-comparison/) (*much shorter*).
Along with the tons of text, it also provides the illustrations which, imho, are pretty fruitful and worthy of time.

## PART 3 - CONCLUSION

I guess that’s it. The idea was to provide you with an important base of knowledge of terms, structures and varieties about the blockchain industry. To sum up, careful studying all the materials mentioned above gives us a sufficient understanding of architectures and principles of **Layer 1** & **2 blockchains**, **Smart contracts**, **DApps**, **Rollups**, **Proof-of-work** & **Proof-of-stake mechanisms**. This knowledge will significantly simplify future studying of incredible **Crypto world**.

> Few more notes before leaving.

I already have some plans and ideas for the future articles, so in case you enjoyed reading such stuff, would you mind to subscribe my [twitter](https://twitter.com/macevoycrypto)? title: Blockchains for Normies
body:
### DESCRIPTION

A first-step guide to raise your knowledge about blockchains’ architecture. This article is a selection of various materials, including articles and videos, arranged in the chronological order to achieve the highest level of effectiveness in step-by-step learning.

I have to clarify – that’s NOT a guide for total beginners in crypto. All content mentioned in the article is for those who are aware of the basic terminology & crypto market in general. FYI, the guide is based on my personal experience.

### CONTENTS

**DESCRIPTION
PART 1 - INTRODUCTION
PART 2 - BLOCKCHAINS
2\.1 - Ethereum
2\.2 - Cosmos
2\.3 - Rollups
2\.4 - Solana
2\.5 - Near
PART 3 - CONCLUSION**

> Hey, thanks for checking out! If you don’t like author to be talkative, just skip the introduction and jump directly to **PART 2**.

## PART 1 - INTRODUCTION

Lately, I’ve heard a lot of similar opinions like “That’s the best time to prepare yourself for the next bull market” or “Get out of charts and do some education instead”. If you actively participated in all the “degen” plays with tokens and NFTs, or were busy as a day-trader for a while, I’d presume there wasn’t enough time for such a silly thing as an **Education**. But isn’t that finally a perfect time as people keep telling us? What if we shift our focus to learn something fundamental? Of course, It’s always nice to earn money by investing or speculating on one or another asset. Especially, when we saw such a great performance of most of the projects and especially blockchains in 2021.

![ATOM/USD - Screenshot from Dropstab.com](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8eJdnSpY41ZFz7qR1dRUx.png?height=1189&width=1813)

![SOL/USD - Screenshot from Dropstab.com](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zftEaJUKtu7syUpofERTE.png?height=1190&width=1820)

And I’m sure many of you got extremely good profits along with that rise. But here are few questions “**Were you aware that LUNA’s death loop is inevitable? Did you try to buy this dip?”.** I have a feeling there are some, at least, who were not and tried so (*either was I*). Let’s not make the same mistakes again. Without further more (*I know you may get tired of a long introduction*) let’s jump into what I prepared for you.

## PART 2 - BLOCKCHAINS

So, education, huh? What can we start with? I’ve been thinking and perceived to start with just fundamental things – **Blockchains** and **Ecosystems**. If you’re interested in boosting your knowledge about blockchains and crypto in general, below you’ll find a selection of the related articles/videos. I found them extremely useful and perfectly fit for non-tech guys or “normies”.

> I have to clarify that the author is aware about whitepapers and other official resources, and that it is the best way to get familiar with functionality of blockchains and crypto protocols. But since the topic of this article is “**Blockchains for Normies**”, I prepared a selection of easy to understand materials to form a basic knowledge of structure and understanding of various tech aspects.

### 2.1 - ΞTHEREUM

We will start with the leading blockchain, the father of Smart contracts, DeFi and NFT – **ETHEREUM**. Some of you could react as “WHAT?! Where the heck is Bitcoin??”. I’m not a big fan of Bitcoin, to be honest, and, since the concept of both blockchains is pretty similar (*in relation to **proof-of-work** mechanism; please don’t kill me, I know there is a big difference called **EVM** - **Ethereum Virtual Machine***), I decided to start with that. The amazing article translated into various languages: 
 [How does Ethereum work, anyway?](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-ethereum-work-anyway). 
 (*I recommend to read it in English since improving English skills is our next big goal – more about that later*).

> If you really decided to dive into all of these things, follow the chronology, since I organized that for better understanding of the whole blockchain theory. Terms met in the first articles can be mentioned in the following ones.

Also, it’s quite compatible to watch this video in parallel with the first article:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOVAbKKSH10&t=5500s](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOVAbKKSH10&t=5500s)

(*Especially if you’re not familiar at all with **Decentralized finances**, **DApps** & **Smart contracts***).

### 2.2 - COSMOS

Okay, we’ve learnt some basic things about how the amazing technology of blockchain actually works. But you may ask “What about **proof-of-stake** concept? I heard many blockchains are based on it as on more energy efficient & more scalable analogue” (*or just “What’s next?”*). Not a big deal – the whole **validation & delegation** idea is greatly described in the next article about COSMOS ecosystem (*in 2 parts*):
[How does Cosmos work? How does it compare to Bitcoin and Ethereum? (Part 1)](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-cosmos-work-how-does-it-compare-to-bitcoin-and-ethereum-part-1);  
 [How does Cosmos work? How does it compare to Bitcoin and Ethereum? (Part 2)](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-cosmos-work-how-does-it-compare-to-bitcoin-and-ethereum-part-2).

”Damn, man, you’re just sending the articles of one particular author… You could send us her link and finish it” – IT’S NOT MY FAULT that her articles are such great for normies. But don’t judge me so fast, here will be more stuff.

### 2.3 - ROLLUPS

As long as we’re aware about the difference between **proof-of-stake** and **proof-of-work** mechanisms, let’s talk about another hot topic – **ZK ROLLUPS**. That’s almost impossible you haven’t seen at least some videos or threads about how promising rollups are, determining it as a next huge trend. I guess, that’s worthy not to put it away: [A normie's guide to rollups](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/a-normies-guide-to-rollups).
And the answer for “Which one is the best finally in that infinite battle?” can be found [here](https://medium.com/offchainlabs/optimistic-rollups-the-present-and-future-of-ethereum-scaling-60fb9067ae87) and [here](https://blog.polygon.technology/zk-and-the-future-of-ethereum-scaling/).

**Spoiler:**
.
.
.
Nobody knows exactly.

### 2.4 - S◎LANA

Next is **SOLANA**. The killer of Ethe… Okay, stop it. Nobody kills nobody. I guess we’ve settled that long time ago, heh. We can start with this article giving us an idea of how the Solana’s **proof-of-history** concept works:
[What Is Solana (SOL)? Learn About Ethereum’s Growing Rival](https://blockworks.co/what-is-solana-everything-you-need-to-know-about-the-ethereum-rival/).

Then check out this video:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rywOYfGu4EA&list=PLilwLeBwGuK6OFXWqyZ88E_ha21Oyr_Rf&index=2](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rywOYfGu4EA&list=PLilwLeBwGuK6OFXWqyZ88E_ha21Oyr_Rf&index=2)

And read the explanation by Solana’s founder Anatoly Yakovenko:
[Proof of History: A Clock for Blockchain](https://medium.com/solana-labs/proof-of-history-a-clock-for-blockchain-cf47a61a9274).

Seems more or less clear? I have to admit there are a lot of concerns and humors regarding Solana’s eligibility and transparency, especially regarding the concept of **proof-of-history**. But let’s leave it for scientists and mathematicians like [Victor Shoup](https://www.shoup.net/papers/poh.pdf) (*You may* *have a look at it, but be careful, it can hurt your brain if you’re not a sort of such guys*).

### 2.5 - NEAR

Let’s dive a little deeper and remind ourselves about **Ethereum 2.0**, its **proof-of-stake** mechanism and, what is the most important, learn about **sharding** technology (*we need it for better understanding of the functionality of our next candidate*). I have to warn you, this part is gonna be more complex comparing to the previous ones:
[Detailed overview of Ethereum 2.0 shard chains: Committees, Proposers and Attesters](https://medium.com/nearprotocol/detailed-overview-of-ethereum-2-0-shard-chains-committees-proposers-and-attesters-a9992d2fd103). (*Well, at least I felt this way*).

> Please note that TxFlow is not relevant at the moment. It’s still under development and testing, so you can skip it for now.

Great! I’m feeling how these articles are becoming easier and easier to deal with (*or not, because you just keep scrolling?!*).

![Author when you don't read the article carefully](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ufWQTbVfyKHwNPAGqPXyM.png?height=900&width=1333)

To be honest, I spent several days trying to find similar easy to read material about the **NEAR** Protocol, but either it was huge, either quite complicated. Finally here it is, right after I spent the whole day reading an official doc (*super lucky?*). But first, if you’re not familiar with the Near protocol at all, briefly check this introduction from the official team: [The Beginner’s Guide to the NEAR Blockchain](https://near.org/blog/the-beginners-guide-to-the-near-blockchain/).

For the rests – overview of the **Near** protocol: [NEAR Protocol ($NEAR)](https://thealpharchives.com/near-protocol-near).

If you haven’t gone through all the links attached to this great article above (*bet 99% you haven’t*), some parts might seem not so clear. Don’t worry, there’re just 2 important links you need to open. But there is a tiny detail… One of these links is exactly the one I’ve called “huge” earlier. If you’re that crazy person – try your passion and patience by reading these:
[Nightshades](https://near.org/downloads/Nightshade.pdf) (*just to clarify – 37 pages, good luck*);
[Doomslug](https://near.org/blog/doomslug-comparison/) (*much shorter*).
Along with the tons of text, it also provides the illustrations which, imho, are pretty fruitful and worthy of time.

## PART 3 - CONCLUSION

I guess that’s it. The idea was to provide you with an important base of knowledge of terms, structures and varieties about the blockchain industry. To sum up, careful studying all the materials mentioned above gives us a sufficient understanding of architectures and principles of **Layer 1** & **2 blockchains**, **Smart contracts**, **DApps**, **Rollups**, **Proof-of-work** & **Proof-of-stake mechanisms**. This knowledge will significantly simplify future studying of incredible **Crypto world**.

> Few more notes before leaving.

I already have some plans and ideas for the future articles, so in case you enjoyed reading such stuff, would you mind to subscribe my [twitter](https://twitter.com/macevoycrypto)? You’ll be notified immediately once it’s ready! Oh, I forgot to give an idea what’s next… Well, I can’t promise anything, but can give you some hint:

![Kinda a roadmap](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9TN1BevBKMzA4-bEBj9E7.png?height=800&width=2000&&&&&&size=medium)

Thanks for your time and sincerely hope you found the whole article useful and valuable. Happy to see any comments & suggestions bellow. See ya soon ❤.

title: Thách thức của các game trên crypto
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/IktneP5DnxOdSXi1bf1x_.jpeg?height=700&width=1400)

Game blockchain đã thu hút được rất nhiều sự quan tâm trong năm vừa qua, nhưng nếu lưu ý kỹ hơn thì những game phổ biến như Axie Infinity, Splinterland, Crabada thật ra có rất ít thành phần on-chain. Họ thường dùng blockchain để  đại diện cho các tài sản trong game bằng NFT hoặc token, nhưng phần logic của game thì được vận hành off-chain (ngoài chuỗi). Một trong những lý do quan trọng là vì chi phí rất cao để tính toán khi sử dụng những blockchain nguyên khối như Ethereum là ví dụ (monolithic blockchain, khác với modular blockchain: đa khối) .

Tuy nhiên, với sự tiến bộ nhanh chóng trong việc mở rộng mà chúng ta đang chứng kiến, đặc biệt trong mảng giải pháp RollUps như StarkNet, Arbitrum, Optimism, Obscuro (soon™), thì việc dịch chuyển phần logic của game lên on-chain ngày càng trở nên khả thi. Những game như vậy có thể được gọi là crypto game thật sự.

Thật là tuyệt, nhưng tại sao chúng ta lại muốn làm việc này ?

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_vU5d8fJXSBL3U76ervOG.jpeg?height=112&width=112)

Tôi đề nghị abạn nên đọc [luận điểm về crypto gaming của Gubsheep](https://gubsheep.substack.com/p/the-strongest-crypto-gaming-thesis) để hiểu vì sao crypto game là biên giới kế tiếp. Để hiểu cách nó mở ra một lĩnh vực đầy tiềm năng mới mà chúng ta chưa từng thấy trước đây. Những thứ chỉ có thể thực hiện được khi bạn triển khai toàn bộ game dưới dạng hợp đồng thông minh (Smartcontract), chẳng hạn như thể loại game tự trị hoặc tổng hợp; khả năng kết hợp on-chain giữa mọi thành phần của mọi game; mã nguồn mở phát triển dẫn đến khả năng sáng tạo vô hạn; trò chơi không cần xin phép, không bị kiểm duyệt, không thể ngăn cản; và nhiều thứ khác nữa…

Nhưng thật sự là còn rất sớm và kèm theo đó là rất nhiều thử thách ở đoạn đường phía trước. Tuy nhiên, tôi nhận ra rằng một số những thách thức phổ biến nhất mà những gamer tiên phong hay gặp phải đều được Obscuro giải quyết rốt ráo.

Đó là những thử thách nào ?

## Giao dịch chạy trước (Front Running)

Nhà phát triển blockchain kỳ cựu [Ronan Sandford](https://twitter.com/wighawag) đã nói về việc [phát triển game trên L2](https://www.youtube.com/watch?t=649&v=4rO4b1SsONU&feature=youtu.be) tại EthCC4 và anh ấy nêu ra vấn đề giao dịch chạy trước:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/m3D-iNLtP2Nbu_lUnch93.png?height=602&width=1072)

Giao dịch chạy trước hoàn toàn có thể xảy vì một người chơi có thể đọc các bước di chuyển của đối thủ trong bộ nhớ công khai, trước khi chúng thực sự xảy ra trong game và có phản ứng tương xứng. Như Sylve đã chỉ ra, điều này tương đương với MEV trong defi, do đó có thuật ngữ gaMEV.

[https://twitter.com/sylvechv/status/1508822102832521217?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1508822102832521217%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fcdn.embedly.com%2Fwidgets%2Fmedia.html%3Ftype%3Dtext2Fhtmlkey%3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07schema%3Dtwitterurl%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2Fsylvechv%2Fstatus%2F1508822102832521217image%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Fi.embed.ly%2F1%2Fimage3Furl3Dhttps253A252F252Fabs.twimg.com252Ferrors252Flogo46x38.png26key3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07](https://twitter.com/sylvechv/status/1508822102832521217?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1508822102832521217%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fcdn.embedly.com%2Fwidgets%2Fmedia.html%3Ftype%3Dtext2Fhtmlkey%3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07schema%3Dtwitterurl%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2Fsylvechv%2Fstatus%2F1508822102832521217image%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Fi.embed.ly%2F1%2Fimage3Furl3Dhttps253A252F252Fabs.twimg.com252Ferrors252Flogo46x38.png26key3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07)

## Ngẫu nhiên (Randomness)

Rất nhiều game dựa trên sự ngẫu nhiên và trong một bài phát biểu gần đây về việc phát triển game hoàn toàn on-chain tại EthCC3, Ronan đã đề cập đến sự khó khăn của việc tạo ra một con số không thể đoán trước được tại mỗi block hoặc mỗi giây.

Thực sự rất khó để tìm thấy một nguồn hỗn độn (Entropy) an toàn trên một blockchain công khai, bởi vì trạng thái nội bộ của hợp đồng, cũng như toàn bộ lịch sử của blockchain, được hiển thị cho bất kỳ ai.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/tP6fq6nY7P4SY2fH1W_Rb.png?height=597&width=1066)

## Thông tin ẩn

Rất nhiều cơ chế game liên quan đến việc che giấu một số thông tin với người chơi và đây là một vấn đề tế nhị cần giải quyết trên sổ cái công khai. Đó là một trong những thách thức được Sylve nêu ra trong bài đăng của anh ấy [Bốn thách thức trong trò chơi blockchain](https://mirror.xyz/sylve.eth/6QJ6taBcobFAWMbijs4WrQrFZ_FGq5wXmJ_NIXW-GmQ), nơi anh ấy giải thích rằng ngay cả một trò chơi đơn giản như oẳn tù tì cũng thực sự khó khăn để xây dựng on-chain và nó sẽ liên quan đến các kỹ thuật như cam kết- tiết lộ các kế hoạch hoặc zero Knowledge Proof (ZKP - *giao thức cho phép chúng ta chứng minh chúng ta biết một kiến thức nào đó nhưng không tiết lộ cho người khác biết kiến thức đó là như thế nào*).

Trong bài đăng [Ngăn chặn những kẻ gian lận trong game chiến tranh có màn sương mù](https://edward-thomson.medium.com/preventing-cheaters-in-fog-of-war-games-69f202fbe107), [Edward A Thomson](https://twitter.com/EAThomson) tìm kiếm một giải pháp để tái tạo lại chuỗi trận [chiến tranh có màn sương mù](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fog_of_war#In_video_games) cổ điển, nơi mục tiêu là che giấu một phần bản đồ hoặc vị trí của kẻ thù.

![Màn sương mù trong game Age of Empires II](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/o58TUT9QucJ9EKBV_OT3j.jpg?height=576&width=1024)

## Obscuro và crypto game

Bạn có thể đã đoán ra, mẫu số chung cho những thách thức được đề cập ở trên - giao dịch chạy trước, tính ngẫu nhiên, sự che giấu thông tin - là tính minh bạch, đó là bản chất của các blockchain công khai. Và đây là nơi Obscuro nổi bật so với các giải pháp tổng hợp khác.

Obscuro là một giải pháp bảo mật lớp 2 phi tập trung được xây dựng trên nền tảng Ethereum. Nó tận dụng Môi trường thực thi tin cậy để tạo các bản tổng hợp bí mật (Confidential Rollups), cho phép mọi hợp đồng thông minh tương thích với EVM được hưởng lợi từ chi phí gas thấp và quyền riêng tư.

Các bản Confidential Rollups của Obscuro giới thiệu quyền riêng tư tính toán, có nghĩa là khả năng làm xáo trộn hoàn toàn các hợp đồng thông minh. Do đó, bạn có thể ẩn bất kỳ phần nào trong trò chơi của mình, bạn có thể sử dụng bất kỳ dữ liệu nào làm nguồn entropy, mempool cũng bị ẩn, v.v.

Có thể có một số mức độ riêng tư với các Zero Knowledge Proof(ZKP) và một trò chơi như Dark Forest là một minh họa hoàn hảo cho điều đó. Tuy nhiên, bằng chứng ZKP không phải là một giải pháp bảo mật có mục đích chung, có nghĩa là chúng không thể làm xáo trộn hoàn toàn các hợp đồng thông minh, theo cách mà Obscuro có thể làm. Để đọc thêm về chủ đề này, bạn có thể đọc thêm về [bộ ba vấn đề về quyền riêng tư blockchain](https://medium.com/obscuro-labs/the-blockchain-privacy-trilemma-part-two-797088183802) của [Cais Manai](https://twitter.com/obscuro_c).

## Một số ý tưởng để phát triển trên Obscuro

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iUITofqqaMKHf2asQCBRb.png?height=364&width=362)

* Phiên bản on-chain của các trò chơi cổ điển như Poker, Battleship, Mastermind…
* Một thể loại trò chơi văn minh với các giải thưởng được giấu sẵn.
* Ý tưởng về [Xổ số ẩn danh](https://killari.medium.com/zero-knowledge-lottery-437e456dc3f2) của [Killari](https://twitter.com/qhuesten).
* Triển khai toàn bộ cốt truyện của game và không ai có thể xem trộm mã nguồn.
* Ứng dụng [Six Moonshot ZK](https://gubsheep.substack.com/p/six-moonshot-zk-applications?utm_source=%2Fprofile%2F1016942-gubsheep&utm_medium=reader2) từ Gubsheep.
* Định hình các NFT có các thuộc tính thay đổi dựa trên bất kỳ sự kiển blockchain hoặc thế giới thực nào. 
* Game tự quản trị, sáng tạo, nơi không ai có thể dự đoán điều gì tiếp theo, ngay cả nhà phát triển game.
* …. Và nhiều hơn nữa.

Tôi muốn cảm ơn tất cả những người được đề cập trong bài đăng này vì ý tưởng của họ, cũng như [biện chứng](https://twitter.com/dialectic_ch) cho [Suy nghĩ của họ về ](https://dialectic.ch/editorial/thoughts-on-chain-gaming)game on-chain vốn là nguồn cảm hứng tuyệt vời.

## Tìm hiểu thêm 

Nếu bạn muốn tìm hiểu thêm về [Obscuro](https://obscu.ro/), hãy xem [Litepaper](https://obscu.ro/litepaper) của chúng tôi hoặc đi sâu vào [whitepaper](https://whitepaper.obscu.ro/) của chúng tôi. title: 人生变好，从停止内耗开始
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Xl46DLQTUQOwRe8fZiALe.jpeg?height=719&width=1078)

《菜根谭》里有句话： 
 不可乘喜而轻诺，不可因醉而生嗔，不可乘快而多事，不可因倦而鲜终。 
 那些自作聪明的举动，不止给别人带来困扰，有时甚至会让自己惹祸上身。 
 不多事，是一个人应该恪守的本

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dZ3vv-_xu0bSILquT0Xd8.jpg?height=250&width=350)

分，更是一种难得的修养。 
 真正懂事的人，知事晓事不多事，专注自己的生活，不替别人操闲心，不掺和别人的事情，自然也远离纷扰、开心顺遂。

世界著名激励大师安东尼·罗宾说过：

“全世界所有的成功者最重要的特征是：创造人脉，维护人脉，人生中最大的财富便是人脉关系，它能让你不断地获得财富。”

也有人说过，未来社会，一个人最大的能力，就叫**“链接力”**。

这个时代，你能链接多少人，决定了你值多少钱。

有人说过：“未来不是人赚钱，而是钱找人。财富永远都会流向最匹配他的人，就是那些高认知的人。”

赚钱，就是认知变现的过程，你的认知有多高，你就能赚多少钱。

你刚拿起它的时候可能只有5克，但你拿着它一整天呢？或许就有千斤重了。

怎么摆脱这种重负呢？

——放下。

奶酪丢了，就立马去找；水杯很重，就立马放下。

**很多时候，一个行动，好过一千个想法；一个改变，远胜过无意义的坚持。**

与其在内耗中折磨自己，不如用行动打破僵局。

就像搜狐董事长张朝阳说的：**缓解焦虑的唯一办法，就是什么也不要想，干了再说。**

**道不同不相为谋，志不同不相为友。**

与其撕破脸，不如安静退场。

默不作声地疏离，才是给彼此最大的体面。

title: Blockchains for Normies
body:
### DESCRIPTION

A first-step guide to raise your knowledge about blockchains’ architecture. This article is a selection of various materials, including articles and videos, arranged in the chronological order to achieve the highest level of effectiveness in step-by-step learning.

I have to clarify – that’s NOT a guide for total beginners in crypto. All content mentioned in the article is for those who are aware of the basic terminology & crypto market in general. FYI, the guide is based on my personal experience.

### CONTENTS

**DESCRIPTION
PART 1 - INTRODUCTION
PART 2 - BLOCKCHAINS
2\.1 - Ethereum
2\.2 - Cosmos
2\.3 - Rollups
2\.4 - Solana
2\.5 - Near
PART 3 - CONCLUSION**

> Hey, thanks for checking out! If you don’t like author to be talkative, just skip the introduction and jump directly to **PART 2**.

## PART 1 - INTRODUCTION

Lately, I’ve heard a lot of similar opinions like “That’s the best time to prepare yourself for the next bull market” or “Get out of charts and do some education instead”. If you actively participated in all the “degen” plays with tokens and NFTs, or were busy as a day-trader for a while, I’d presume there wasn’t enough time for such a silly thing as an **Education**. But isn’t that finally a perfect time as people keep telling us? What if we shift our focus to learn something fundamental? Of course, It’s always nice to earn money by investing or speculating on one or another asset. Especially, when we saw such a great performance of most of the projects and especially blockchains in 2021.

![ATOM/USD - Screenshot from Dropstab.com](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8eJdnSpY41ZFz7qR1dRUx.png?height=1189&width=1813)

![SOL/USD - Screenshot from Dropstab.com](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zftEaJUKtu7syUpofERTE.png?height=1190&width=1820)

And I’m sure many of you got extremely good profits along with that rise. But here are few questions “**Were you aware that LUNA’s death loop is inevitable? Did you try to buy this dip?”.** I have a feeling there are some, at least, who were not and tried so (*either was I*). Let’s not make the same mistakes again. Without further more (*I know you may get tired of a long introduction*) let’s jump into what I prepared for you.

## PART 2 - BLOCKCHAINS

So, education, huh? What can we start with? I’ve been thinking and perceived to start with just fundamental things – **Blockchains** and **Ecosystems**. If you’re interested in boosting your knowledge about blockchains and crypto in general, below you’ll find a selection of the related articles/videos. I found them extremely useful and perfectly fit for non-tech guys or “normies”.

> I have to clarify that the author is aware about whitepapers and other official resources, and that it is the best way to get familiar with functionality of blockchains and crypto protocols. But since the topic of this article is “**Blockchains for Normies**”, I prepared a selection of easy to understand materials to form a basic knowledge of structure and understanding of various tech aspects.

### 2.1 - ΞTHEREUM

We will start with the leading blockchain, the father of Smart contracts, DeFi and NFT – **ETHEREUM**. Some of you could react as “WHAT?! Where the heck is Bitcoin??”. I’m not a big fan of Bitcoin, to be honest, and, since the concept of both blockchains is pretty similar (*in relation to **proof-of-work** mechanism; please don’t kill me, I know there is a big difference called **EVM** - **Ethereum Virtual Machine***), I decided to start with that. The amazing article translated into various languages: 
 [How does Ethereum work, anyway?](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-ethereum-work-anyway). 
 (*I recommend to read it in English since improving English skills is our next big goal – more about that later*).

> If you really decided to dive into all of these things, follow the chronology, since I organized that for better understanding of the whole blockchain theory. Terms met in the first articles can be mentioned in the following ones.

Also, it’s quite compatible to watch this video in parallel with the first article:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOVAbKKSH10&t=5500s](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOVAbKKSH10&t=5500s)

(*Especially if you’re not familiar at all with **Decentralized finances**, **DApps** & **Smart contracts***).

### 2.2 - COSMOS

Okay, we’ve learnt some basic things about how the amazing technology of blockchain actually works. But you may ask “What about **proof-of-stake** concept? I heard many blockchains are based on it as on more energy efficient & more scalable analogue” (*or just “What’s next?”*). Not a big deal – the whole **validation & delegation** idea is greatly described in the next article about COSMOS ecosystem (*in 2 parts*):
[How does Cosmos work? How does it compare to Bitcoin and Ethereum? (Part 1)](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-cosmos-work-how-does-it-compare-to-bitcoin-and-ethereum-part-1);  
 [How does Cosmos work? How does it compare to Bitcoin and Ethereum? (Part 2)](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-cosmos-work-how-does-it-compare-to-bitcoin-and-ethereum-part-2).

”Damn, man, you’re just sending the articles of one particular author… You could send us her link and finish it” – IT’S NOT MY FAULT that her articles are such great for normies. But don’t judge me so fast, here will be more stuff.

### 2.3 - ROLLUPS

As long as we’re aware about the difference between **proof-of-stake** and **proof-of-work** mechanisms, let’s talk about another hot topic – **ZK ROLLUPS**. That’s almost impossible you haven’t seen at least some videos or threads about how promising rollups are, determining it as a next huge trend. I guess, that’s worthy not to put it away: [A normie's guide to rollups](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/a-normies-guide-to-rollups).
And the answer for “Which one is the best finally in that infinite battle?” can be found [here](https://medium.com/offchainlabs/optimistic-rollups-the-present-and-future-of-ethereum-scaling-60fb9067ae87) and [here](https://blog.polygon.technology/zk-and-the-future-of-ethereum-scaling/).

**Spoiler:**
.
.
.
Nobody knows exactly.

### 2.4 - S◎LANA

Next is **SOLANA**. The killer of Ethe… Okay, stop it. Nobody kills nobody. I guess we’ve settled that long time ago, heh. We can start with this article giving us an idea of how the Solana’s **proof-of-history** concept works:
[What Is Solana (SOL)? Learn About Ethereum’s Growing Rival](https://blockworks.co/what-is-solana-everything-you-need-to-know-about-the-ethereum-rival/).

Then check out this video:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rywOYfGu4EA&list=PLilwLeBwGuK6OFXWqyZ88E_ha21Oyr_Rf&index=2](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rywOYfGu4EA&list=PLilwLeBwGuK6OFXWqyZ88E_ha21Oyr_Rf&index=2)

And read the explanation by Solana’s founder Anatoly Yakovenko:
[Proof of History: A Clock for Blockchain](https://medium.com/solana-labs/proof-of-history-a-clock-for-blockchain-cf47a61a9274).

Seems more or less clear? I have to admit there are a lot of concerns and humors regarding Solana’s eligibility and transparency, especially regarding the concept of **proof-of-history**. But let’s leave it for scientists and mathematicians like [Victor Shoup](https://www.shoup.net/papers/poh.pdf) (*You may* *have a look at it, but be careful, it can hurt your brain if you’re not a sort of such guys*).

### 2.5 - NEAR

Let’s dive a little deeper and remind ourselves about **Ethereum 2.0**, its **proof-of-stake** mechanism and, what is the most important, learn about **sharding** technology (*we need it for better understanding of the functionality of our next candidate*). I have to warn you, this part is gonna be more complex comparing to the previous ones:
[Detailed overview of Ethereum 2.0 shard chains: Committees, Proposers and Attesters](https://medium.com/nearprotocol/detailed-overview-of-ethereum-2-0-shard-chains-committees-proposers-and-attesters-a9992d2fd103). (*Well, at least I felt this way*).

> Please note that TxFlow is not relevant at the moment. It’s still under development and testing, so you can skip it for now.

Great! I’m feeling how these articles are becoming easier and easier to deal with (*or not, because you just keep scrolling?!*).

![Author when you don't read the article carefully](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ufWQTbVfyKHwNPAGqPXyM.png?height=900&width=1333)

To be honest, I spent several days trying to find similar easy to read material about the **NEAR** Protocol, but either it was huge, either quite complicated. Finally here it is, right after I spent the whole day reading an official doc (*super lucky?*). But first, if you’re not familiar with the Near protocol at all, briefly check this introduction from the official team: [The Beginner’s Guide to the NEAR Blockchain](https://near.org/blog/the-beginners-guide-to-the-near-blockchain/).

For the rests – overview of the **Near** protocol: [NEAR Protocol ($NEAR)](https://thealpharchives.com/near-protocol-near).

If you haven’t gone through all the links attached to this great article above (*bet 99% you haven’t*), some parts might seem not so clear. Don’t worry, there’re just 2 important links you need to open. But there is a tiny detail… One of these links is exactly the one I’ve called “huge” earlier. If you’re that crazy person – try your passion and patience by reading these:
[Nightshades](https://near.org/downloads/Nightshade.pdf) (*just to clarify – 37 pages, good luck*);
[Doomslug](https://near.org/blog/doomslug-comparison/) (*much shorter*).
Along with the tons of text, it also provides the illustrations which, imho, are pretty fruitful and worthy of time.

## PART 3 - CONCLUSION

I guess that’s it. The idea was to provide you with an important base of knowledge of terms, structures and varieties about the blockchain industry. To sum up, careful studying all the materials mentioned above gives us a sufficient understanding of architectures and principles of **Layer 1** & **2 blockchains**, **Smart contracts**, **DApps**, **Rollups**, **Proof-of-work** & **Proof-of-stake mechanisms**. This knowledge will significantly simplify future studying of incredible **Crypto world**.

> Few more notes before leaving.

I already have some plans and ideas for the future articles, so in case you enjoyed reading such stuff, would you mind to subscribe my [twitter](https://twitter.com/macevoycrypto)? You’ll be notified immediately once it’s ready! Oh, I forgot to give an idea what’s next… Well, I can’t promise anything, but can give you some hint:

![Kinda a roadmap](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9TN1BevBKMzA4-bEBj9E7.png?height=800&width=2000&&&&&&size=medium)

Thanks for your time and sincerely hope you found the whole article useful and valuable. Happy to see any comments & suggestions. See ya soon ❤.

title: PLUTO - новый проект в экосистеме Waves
body:
**Вкратце**, что за проект, и какие основные механики.

“*Pluto — это инновационный дизайн резервной валюты. Это устойчивый к медвежьим рынкам финансовый инструмент, обеспечивающий долгосрочный и планомерный рост рыночной цены актива.”*

Основа проекта - **сверхобеспеченный токен PLUTO** с высоким APY (годовая процентная ставка) стейкинга. Высокий APY достигается за счёт обеспечения токена (казна), которое представляет собой в основном (не менее 80%) **LP токены пар стейблкойнов**, в проектах типа vires.finance, waves.exchange, puzzleswap.org, swop.fi. В казну также войдут **токены LP из пула PLUTO**, запущенного на **Puzzle Swap**, чтобы гарантировать достаточный уровень ликвидности.

## Регуляция курса - байбэки, и механизм увеличения ликвидности протокола

**Регуляция курса** выглядит следующим образом (**Очень вкратце**): есть обеспечение (казна) и есть эмиссия. Делим обеспечение на эмиссию, получаем **минимальную цену** (обеспеченную цену). Умножаем минимальную цену на 3, получаем **максимальную цену**. И далее:

### Если падаем

Если стоимость токена **PLUTO** приближается к обеспеченной (минимальной) цене - из казны **выделяются средства на байбэк**, и производится этот самый байбэк - обратный выкуп токенов PLUTO с последующим их **сжиганием**. Таким образом **избыточное предложение уменьшается**, а **APY растёт**, а с ним **растёт и спрос** на токен.

### Если слишком активно растём

Если стоимость токена **PLUTO** приближается к **максимальной цене**, то выпускаются новые токены PLUTO для их продажи по \~этой максимальной цене. Таким образом **дополнительно растёт казна**, и порог **минимальной и максимальной цены - увеличивается**.

Чем **больше денег** в казне - **тем выше минимальная** и **максимальная цена**.

## Что там про покупку токена за LP?

Совсем скоро будет введена возможность покупки токена Pluto **за LP токены** проектов экосистемы Waves. Вначале это будут LP токены пулов стейблкойнов проекта **vires.finance**, затем их список будет **увеличиваться**.

Покупка Pluto за LP токены будет происходить с выгодой для покупателя, но будет **некоторый период блокировки** купленных токенов (4-9 дней), и на этот период блокировки будет начисляться космический APY - от 532%, до 75050% 👀

Подобные покупки будут как увеличивать казну Pluto, **увеличивая минимальную** и **максимальную** цену, так и **улучшать стабильность** протоколов ликвидности.

Это вкратце **по основным** моментам. Больше тонкостей по формированию казны и **остальным механикам** вы можете прочитать **в оригинальной статье**:

[https://mirror.xyz/0x81dd3A4EAE9991D40C0F2879cA91C43f5785F3F5/QVdQCHnKiyK_Us06P4e3TpKFlB8Jifd05VodpEjMghg](https://mirror.xyz/0x81dd3A4EAE9991D40C0F2879cA91C43f5785F3F5/QVdQCHnKiyK_Us06P4e3TpKFlB8Jifd05VodpEjMghg)

На момент публикации статьи, купить токен можно на **waves exchange**:

[https://waves.exchange/trading/spot/Ajso6nTTjptu2UHLx6hfSXVtHFtRBJCkKYd5SAyj7zf5_USDN](https://waves.exchange/trading/spot/Ajso6nTTjptu2UHLx6hfSXVtHFtRBJCkKYd5SAyj7zf5_USDN)

Позже будут доступны пулы ликвидности на **swop.fi** и **puzzleswap.org**

title: Metagovernance Project（
body:
美国大选举世瞩目。DAO的选举几人问津？

堕胎权能引发全社会的大讨论。有多少人参与了Web3的治理讨论？

Google Scholar中“美国政治”词条下的论文一辈子也读不完。又有多少学术思考关注了“crypto政治”？

在恨铁不成钢的时候有没有反思过关注不够？

在伤感DAO的问题的同时是否想过我们骂了太多思考地太少？

DAO的答案尚需我们进一步去探寻。

## Web3治理和Cryptopolitics

众多DAO组织于2021至2022两年中蓬勃兴起。繁荣过后，熊市呼啸而来，多少还在坚持，多少已成笑柄。

最近一篇好文流传甚广—— “[国人 DAO 大败局：放心吧！我们都实现不了去中心化自治](https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/u66m0xCZNBwuY8__4XtMvg)”，虽然题目激进，其中对DAO的批判很能切中要害。这些问题不仅存在于国人DAO中，我亲历了不少DAO，可以说老外的DAO也存在同样的问题。感同身受，叹息不已。

不破不立。对DAO反思是一个好现象，只是在“破”之余，我更需要的是“立”，找出更好的建设DAO的方法。

科研是进步的力量，这一点在网络世界Web3中同样试用。实践的同时我们也需要严肃的研究。

西半球已经有一群人在做了，从成员姓名来看，其骨干中还有华人。

他们从底层入手，解决基础问题，为线上治理创立标准和基础设施。同时还将Cryptopolitics作为单独的研究对象看待。这一点很有趣。“有人的地方就有江湖”，涉及到利益的分配就必然有政治。DAO在Web3中作为治理层存在，发挥着上层建筑的作用。对其更有针对性的研究还是很必要的。

不妨从这些人的实践中看看他们是如何“立”——追寻DAO的答案的。

## 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/sQSxzSFsRNadMNUAINubM.jpg?height=1600&width=2560)

## \\

Metagov是一个跨学科的研究共同体。目标是为数字自治设立标准并搭建基础设施。

为数字自治设立标准和基础设施即是为Web3治理搭建一个底层规则。就好比为所有EVM的DAPP创建一个solidity语言。不得不说这个目标志向高远，野心很大。

该组织2020年1月左右成立，已经做了不少事情，可以从一下几个侧面更好地了解一下这个组织。

title: Spot The Alpha: A Comparison of Recent Free Mint Collections
body:
Recently there has been a trend of free mint NFT collections and some of them have excelled by a huge margin. Some famous free mints include Goblintown, We Are All Going To Die, and Ill Poop It. Now let's look at their historical peak floor price.

## Key Takeaways

1. A high-demand free mint will be minted out in a very short period of time, making the majority of NFT buyers only able to purchase on the secondary market.
2. A good free mint will have a high ratio of only minting 1 NFT per wallet to avoid manipulation.
3. The survival of projects that have free mints will depend highly on their trading volume post mint.
4. Free mint NFTs that started with large volume post mint are not likely to go further as more speculators and traders are trying to take some profits.

### Latest Free Mint Collection and Their Peak Floor Price

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/v8soPmBN8UqpmRvFWr8DJ.png?height=900&width=1600)

We can see the outlier is Goblintown, which reached above 7 ETH in the past month. This is amazing considering the mint cost is 0 ETH. Some other NFT collections that reached above 1 ETH including Killabear, We Are All Going To Die, Ill Poop It NFT, and God Hates NFTees, and WZRDS. Others that have yet to surpass a 1 ETH floor include For The Culture, and Moonrunners.

What makes them different from each other? How do we spot the next trending free mint NFTs? To understand the whole process of free minting, we will need to analyze the period of the minting phase. 

### Latest Free Mint Collection Stats During Minting Phase

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/juEwmd9LjQ4p8JfBlW1xt.png?height=900&width=1600)

We break down the first 12 hours of the minting phase of these free mint collections, as it is one of the most crucial phases in determining if an NFT collection is in high demand. The 2 largeset spikes on the chart are from We Are All Going To Die and Goblintown, which minted out in less than an hour. Noticed how Goblintown minted out quick, in the 5th hour of minting, rather than being fully minted out in the first hour. The next one is We Are All Going To Die. It minted out in the second hour of the minting phase.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8S_8O494-rp_qkX0648WL.png?height=900&width=1600)

Next, we look at the ratio of how many wallets only minted 1 free NFT of each collection. Other than Moonrunners, Ill Poop It, and Killabear, the rest had over 90% of minters with only 1 NFT minted free. This guarantees a fair distribution in each wallet and reduces the risk of manipulation by certain groups of NFT traders. What comes next is also crucial in the survival of the free mint NFT collections.

## Free Mint NFT Collection Post Mint Stats

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/nJg2F1FD1rP1t633IYHHj.png?height=900&width=1600)

After the minting phase, NFT buyers can only purchase those NFTs on the secondary market. The graph above shows the volume in the first 48 hours, post-minting phase. There are 3 spikes of volume that are worth noting. The first spike happened in the first 8 hours of the WZRDS and We Are All Going To Die. The second spike is during 16-28 hours post mint of the same collection, We Are All Going To Die. The last spike observed is from Goblintown NFT. Recall only Goblintown survived and went above 2 ETH compared to the rest of the free mint NFT collections. What can we learn from this chart? Those collections that started with large volume slowly decayed and the floor went underwater.

From the Holder Trends for Goblintown, we are able to see Whale Holders are slowly increasing instead of a huge spike, compared to We Are All Going To Die. The Whale Holders in We Are All Going To Die NFT dropped from the top and decrease rapidly.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1M5Rh_2WbX1Rcc5uqRIcd.png?height=900&width=1600)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ergQdkvdC4HJoxAQRnG1D.png?height=900&width=1600)

title: Blockchains for Normies
body:
### DESCRIPTION

A first-step guide to raise your knowledge about blockchains’ architecture. This article is a selection of various materials, including articles and videos, arranged in the chronological order to achieve the highest level of effectiveness in step-by-step learning.

I have to clarify – that’s NOT a guide for total beginners in crypto. All content mentioned in the article is for those who are aware of the basic terminology & crypto market in general. FYI, the guide is based on my personal experience.

### CONTENTS

**DESCRIPTION
PART 1 - INTRODUCTION
PART 2 - BLOCKCHAINS
2\.1 - Ethereum
2\.2 - Cosmos
2\.3 - Rollups
2\.4 - Solana
2\.5 - Near
PART 3 - CONCLUSION**

> Hey, thanks for checking out! If you don’t like author to be talkative, just skip the introduction and jump directly to **PART 2**.

## PART 1 - INTRODUCTION

Lately, I’ve heard a lot of similar opinions like “That’s the best time to prepare yourself for the next bull market” or “Get out of charts and do some education instead”. If you actively participated in all the “degen” plays with tokens and NFTs, or were busy as a day-trader for a while, I’d presume there wasn’t enough time for such a silly thing as an **Education**. But isn’t that finally a perfect time as people keep telling us? What if we shift our focus to learn something fundamental? Of course, It’s always nice to earn money by investing or speculating on one or another asset. Especially, when we saw such a great performance of most of the projects and especially blockchains in 2021.

![ATOM/USD - Screenshot from Dropstab.com](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8eJdnSpY41ZFz7qR1dRUx.png?height=1189&width=1813)

![SOL/USD - Screenshot from Dropstab.com](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zftEaJUKtu7syUpofERTE.png?height=1190&width=1820)

And I’m sure many of you got extremely good profits along with that rise. But here are few questions “**Were you aware that LUNA’s death loop is inevitable? Did you try to buy this dip?”.** I have a feeling there are some, at least, who were not and tried so (*either was I*). Let’s not make the same mistakes again. Without further more (*I know you may get tired of a long introduction*) let’s jump into what I prepared for you.

## PART 2 - BLOCKCHAINS

So, education, huh? What can we start with? I’ve been thinking and perceived to start with just fundamental things – **Blockchains** and **Ecosystems**. If you’re interested in boosting your knowledge about blockchains and crypto in general, below you’ll find a selection of the related articles/videos. I found them extremely useful and perfectly fit for non-tech guys or “normies”.

> I have to clarify that the author is aware about whitepapers and other official resources, and that it is the best way to get familiar with functionality of blockchains and crypto protocols. But since the topic of this article is “**Blockchains for Normies**”, I prepared a selection of easy to understand materials to form a basic knowledge of structure and understanding of various tech aspects.

### 2.1 - ΞTHEREUM

We will start with the leading blockchain, the father of Smart contracts, DeFi and NFT – **ETHEREUM**. Some of you could react as “WHAT?! Where the heck is Bitcoin??”. I’m not a big fan of Bitcoin, to be honest, and, since the concept of both blockchains is pretty similar (*in relation to **proof-of-work** mechanism; please don’t kill me, I know there is a big difference called **EVM** - **Ethereum Virtual Machine***), I decided to start with that. The amazing article translated into various languages:
[How does Ethereum work, anyway?](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-ethereum-work-anyway).
(*I recommend to read it in English since improving English skills is our next big goal – more about that later*).

> If you really decided to dive into all of these things, follow the chronology, since I organized that for better understanding of the whole blockchain theory. Terms met in the first articles can be mentioned in the following ones.

Also, it’s quite compatible to watch this video in parallel with the first article:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOVAbKKSH10&t=5500s](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOVAbKKSH10&t=5500s)

(*Especially if you’re not familiar at all with **Decentralized finances**, **DApps** & **Smart contracts***).

### 2.2 - COSMOS

Okay, we’ve learnt some basic things about how the amazing technology of blockchain actually works. But you may ask “What about **proof-of-stake** concept? I heard many blockchains are based on it as on more energy efficient & more scalable analogue” (*or just “What’s next?”*). Not a big deal – the whole **validation & delegation** idea is greatly described in the next article about COSMOS ecosystem (*in 2 parts*):
[How does Cosmos work? How does it compare to Bitcoin and Ethereum? (Part 1)](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-cosmos-work-how-does-it-compare-to-bitcoin-and-ethereum-part-1);[How does Cosmos work? How does it compare to Bitcoin and Ethereum? (Part 2)](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/how-does-cosmos-work-how-does-it-compare-to-bitcoin-and-ethereum-part-2).

”Damn, man, you’re just sending the articles of one particular author… You could send us her link and finish it” – IT’S NOT MY FAULT that her articles are such great for normies. But don’t judge me so fast, here will be more stuff.

### 2.3 - ROLLUPS

As long as we’re aware about the difference between **proof-of-stake** and **proof-of-work** mechanisms, let’s talk about another hot topic – **ZK ROLLUPS**. That’s almost impossible you haven’t seen at least some videos or threads about how promising rollups are, determining it as a next huge trend. I guess, that’s worthy not to put it away: [A normie's guide to rollups](https://www.preethikasireddy.com/post/a-normies-guide-to-rollups).
And the answer for “Which one is the best finally in that infinite battle?” can be found [here](https://medium.com/offchainlabs/optimistic-rollups-the-present-and-future-of-ethereum-scaling-60fb9067ae87) and [here](https://blog.polygon.technology/zk-and-the-future-of-ethereum-scaling/).

**Spoiler:**
.
.
.
Nobody knows exactly.

### 2.4 - S◎LANA

Next is **SOLANA**. The killer of Ethe… Okay, stop it. Nobody kills nobody. I guess we’ve settled that long time ago, heh. We can start with this article giving us an idea of how the Solana’s **proof-of-history** concept works:
[What Is Solana (SOL)? Learn About Ethereum’s Growing Rival](https://blockworks.co/what-is-solana-everything-you-need-to-know-about-the-ethereum-rival/).

Then check out this video:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rywOYfGu4EA&list=PLilwLeBwGuK6OFXWqyZ88E_ha21Oyr_Rf&index=2](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rywOYfGu4EA&list=PLilwLeBwGuK6OFXWqyZ88E_ha21Oyr_Rf&index=2)

And read the explanation by Solana’s founder Anatoly Yakovenko:
[Proof of History: A Clock for Blockchain](https://medium.com/solana-labs/proof-of-history-a-clock-for-blockchain-cf47a61a9274).

Seems more or less clear? I have to admit there are a lot of concerns and humors regarding Solana’s eligibility and transparency, especially regarding the concept of **proof-of-history**. But let’s leave it for scientists and mathematicians like [Victor Shoup](https://www.shoup.net/papers/poh.pdf) (*You may* *have a look at it, but be careful, it can hurt your brain if you’re not a sort of such guys*).

### 2.5 - NEAR

Let’s dive a little deeper and remind ourselves about **Ethereum 2.0**, its **proof-of-stake** mechanism and, what is the most important, learn about **sharding** technology (*we need it for better understanding of the functionality of our next candidate*). I have to warn you, this part is gonna be more complex comparing to the previous ones:
[Detailed overview of Ethereum 2.0 shard chains: Committees, Proposers and Attesters](https://medium.com/nearprotocol/detailed-overview-of-ethereum-2-0-shard-chains-committees-proposers-and-attesters-a9992d2fd103). (*Well, at least I felt this way*).

> Please note that TxFlow is not relevant at the moment. It’s still under development and testing, so you can skip it for now.

Great! I’m feeling how these articles are becoming easier and easier to deal with (*or not, because you just keep scrolling?!*).

![Author when you don't read the article carefully](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ufWQTbVfyKHwNPAGqPXyM.png?height=900&width=1333)

To be honest, I spent several days trying to find similar easy to read material about the **NEAR** Protocol, but either it was huge, either quite complicated. Finally here it is, right after I spent the whole day reading an official doc (*super lucky?*). But first, if you’re not familiar with the Near protocol at all, briefly check this introduction from the official team: [The Beginner’s Guide to the NEAR Blockchain](https://near.org/blog/the-beginners-guide-to-the-near-blockchain/).

For the rests – overview of the **Near** protocol: [NEAR Protocol ($NEAR)](https://thealpharchives.com/near-protocol-near).

If you haven’t gone through all the links attached to this great article above (*bet 99% you haven’t*), some parts might seem not so clear. Don’t worry, there’re just 2 important links you need to open. But there is a tiny detail… One of these links is exactly the one I’ve called “huge” earlier. If you’re that crazy person – try your passion and patience by reading these:
[Nightshades](https://near.org/downloads/Nightshade.pdf) (*just to clarify – 37 pages, good luck*);
[Doomslug](https://near.org/blog/doomslug-comparison/) (*much shorter*).
Along with the tons of text, it also provides the illustrations which, imho, are pretty fruitful and worthy of time.

## PART 3 - CONCLUSION

I guess that’s it. The idea was to provide you with an important base of knowledge of terms, structures and varieties about the blockchain industry. To sum up, careful studying all the materials mentioned above gives us a sufficient understanding of architectures and principles of **Layer 1** & **2 blockchains**, **Smart contracts**, **DApps**, **Rollups**, **Proof-of-work** & **Proof-of-stake mechanisms**. This knowledge will significantly simplify future studying of incredible **Crypto world**.

> Few more notes before leaving.

I already have some plans and ideas for the future articles, so in case you enjoyed reading such stuff, would you mind to subscribe my [twitter](https://twitter.com/macevoy_eth)? You’ll be notified immediately once it’s ready! Oh, I forgot to give an idea what’s next… Well, I can’t promise anything, but can give you some hint:

![Kinda a roadmap](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9TN1BevBKMzA4-bEBj9E7.png?height=800&width=2000&&&&&&&size=medium)

Thanks for your time and sincerely hope you found the whole article useful and valuable. Happy to see any comments & suggestions. See ya soon ❤.

title: 我在链游里当托儿
body:
今天聊一聊我在链游里当托儿的故事。

由于人家官方让我保密，所以这里不提游戏名哦\~

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/f1BwKLs8Ou6SAyNOUg5Y5.png?height=183&width=275)

其实游戏刚开始的时候还挺有意思的，随着章节故事的推进，所有有实力的帮派都向着大地图中间推进。

因为中间的资源比较多，对发育非常有利，一开始没那么多工作室，所以在大地图外围是没啥战争发生。

随着大家都聚集在中间位置，那么战斗不可避免的就要发生了。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9r8jGKG3MrPLqkTDWZhXy.png?height=195&width=259)

游戏我刚玩的时候就有个很厉害的帮派，帮主是老外，他们的成员好像都是内测玩家，ID都是几十的短号，我进游戏的时候已经上千了。

刚开始玩，我的采集队伍就老被他们打。

我当时想反正采集被打也没什么损失，无所谓，也不知道为啥打我，打别人采集也获得不了啥好东西。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wNI1MjEic8FjgSczgnkkF.png?height=224&width=224)

后来越玩越上头，小氪之外还买了几个NFT。

这个游戏最神奇的就是NFT英雄比普通的英雄强的太多，一个队伍只要领头的英雄强，那么就是战无不克。

后来有的NFT强到直接秒杀别人，我们帮派被秒的体无完肤，被打的节节败退。

我当时就想啊，这游戏NFT也太变态了，打开战斗日志一看，好家伙！1400%攻击力加成，100%伤害减免这是啥逆天属性，这还怎么玩？

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lmbzw_9nDdxOd8BqeS5ra.png?height=192&width=646)

我立刻就去官方DC开票问他们，这是正常属性？

官方立刻就说这是BUG，我们会修复，你们的损失我们弥补。

这不错啊，弥补损失，我立刻把帮派所有的损失报上去了，过了一天所有人都拿到了补偿。

这里有个小故事，就是我说我们帮派阵亡了5万士兵，重伤了50万士兵。

结果直接给我的账号多了50万士兵...我都惊了，这是要让我当托儿啊！

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Lh5cCCaC4dfrpODNKyo22.png?height=446&width=432)

关键你知道他们怎么发补偿吗？他们居然挨个登录每个人的账号，给账号充钱，然后秒资源和士兵...

这其实也说明一个问题，他们不会操作数据库的数据，应该是代理的游戏那种。

这问题反馈了之后后来又遇见过几次变态的NFT英雄，跟官方反馈之后他们居然直接停了NFT英雄的那些技能释放...

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/sH5kIpEPq41eaHwajDopq.png?height=1000&width=1498)

说是完全修复了再开放，好家伙，都没有任何提前的预告，也没跟玩家商量，就把NFT英雄给废了...

直到我写文章的今天，他们也没修复完成...

这个问题一出，那NFT的价格也是直线下跌。

其实NFT英雄暂停之后，大家拼的就是战斗力了。

只要充钱，就能变强。

像我们帮派个个都是穷逼，要不是有个大佬众多的盟友，我们早就被打跑了。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Mv63wkf9jO4T76v-Lw-eP.png?height=221&width=228)

但就在这个时候，那个神秘的外国帮派出现了一位神秘的大佬，这里就叫他bkb吧。

这游戏有一个机制，就是你如果用谷歌商店直充，会送礼包给帮派所有成员。

因为bkb大佬每次都是直充，无论链上多便宜，都是直充，所以他们帮派的礼包每天都很多。

我们帮派都有几个人的小号在对面拿礼包，每天拿到手软。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Gvh8aT5R-wQ-Cdlzq_vke.png?height=224&width=225)

bkb大佬那充值给我的感觉钱就是个数字，战斗力也是疯狂提升。

这游戏打架的话一般不会打别人的基地，因为游戏设计是攻击玩家基地会阵亡大量的士兵。

但是这个bkb就不一样了，管你是谁，上去就打你基地，不打着火不算完。

即使bkb得不到任何收获，也会攻击基地，乐此不疲。

我们当时想可能就是大佬吧，钱多任性，我们就疯狂送上去被大佬打，反正我们也没啥损失。

但是到了后来，这个大佬不直充了，帮派里面没有礼包了，链上也没有大额的成交，但是bkb的战斗力没有停止。
